147456.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 124 - Dec 1985)
147456.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #124
December 1985

Cover art by Dave Bryant.

147457.name: The Great Persuader
147457.description:
Each turn in The Great Persuader, two players – the "Persuaders" – try to convince another player – the "Customer" – either that their "bad" offer (e.g., "Working as a scarecrow") is good for him, or that their "good" offer (e.g., "Winning the lottery") is not what he is looking for. The Customer listens to both Persuaders, then chooses the offer from one of them. In the meantime, all of the other players bet on which Persuader will prevail. The goal of the game is to get the highest score, proving that you are the great persuader!

The Great Persuader includes 220 offers as well as ten rule variants for experienced players.

147458.name: Skirmish Sangin
147458.description:
Skimish Sangin is a new set of skirmish rules designed specifically for the Afghan conflict. Playing at an individual figure level, players get to feel the intenseness of adrenaline fuelled modern warfare, while still dealing with the responsibility of command.

From a game preview;

"Skirmish Sangin isn’t an IGO UGO game; characters are activated in combat phases based on their BODY attribute. The BODY attribute of the character dictates which of the ten phases of a combat round a character is active in – the higher their BODY (BDY) attribute, the earlier a character’s combat phases occur."

The game is designed as a realistic narrative miniature conflict game based on a modern theatre of war.

As such weapons are realistic, wounds have consequences, and players are left with a realistic story to tell.

147459.name: HeroClix: BioShock Infinite
147459.description:
Partnering with Irrational Games, WizKids brings you BioShock Infinite Heroclix!

From the WizKids site:

BioShock: Infinite comes alive on your tabletop with this all-new HeroClix offering based on the blockbuster game! Booker DeWitt, the Boys of Silence, and more characters from the BioShock: Infinite universe are available to enhance your existing HeroClix experience, or relive the excitement of the BioShock: Infinite video game and play with these figures in a standalone HeroClix match!

BioShock Infinite Heroclix are sold in both a 6-figure Starter Set and a 24-figure Gravity Feed.

147460.name: In Nomine Satanis

rpg.4631: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (2nd Edition)

147460.description:
user summary

German Translation of the "in Nomine Satanis" part of In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (second edition).
Published as a deluxe stand-alone softcover.

147461.name: Konzernreport 2020
147461.description:
user summary

"Konzernreport 2020" is a translation of the Arasaka part of the Corporation Report 2020, Vol. 1.
It is presented as a business folio and includes:
- a 44-page booklet detailing Arasaka
- a character sheet pad and handouts
- a Cyberpunk 2020 sticker

147463.name: AI War: Vengeance of the Machine
147463.description:
Planetary Subcommanders Have It In For You

The AI's gotten kind of upset. Somewhere along the way it decided you puny humans need more interesting ways to lose (or win, if you're one of those people, but who are we to judge). Vengeance of the Machine offers new tools to the player (like Core Turret Controllers) and a new frontal-confrontation victory condition (Showdown Devices), but focuses on enhancing the already-incredible variety of your main opponent: the AI. The possibilities grow exponentially with the addition of the new "Dual Type AI" system (ever wonder what a single AI player would be like with Thief AND Speed-Racer? Find out!), AI Planetary Subcommanders, and Dire Guardians. They say the best stories revolve around an awesome villain, and this expansion takes AI War's villainy to new heights.

For the exhaustive list of features, please see this page on the wiki.

Key Features


8 new AI types, from the honorable "Chivalric" which refuses to harass your Advanced Factories and other irreplaceables to the bleedingly-hard "Vicious Exotic" which eschews normal waves in favor of hammering you with massive Exogalactic Attacks.
2 new Map styles: Wheel and Honeycomb.
6 new Bonus Ship Types, from the modular Protector Starship to the hilarious "space dock artillery cannon" Neinzul Railpod.
2 new optional AI Plots: Hunter (which brings the AI's Special Forces from strong to nightmarish) and Shark.
5 new Core Guard Posts to defend the AI homeworlds.
7 new Guardian types to add variety to the AI's heavier units.
28 new achievements.
More awesome music from Pablo Vega!


Source: The Game Website.

147465.name: Scribe's Arena
147465.description:
Scribe’s Arena is a new tabletop word game based in a beautiful fantasy world. In the battle between scribes, players will formulate their own Words of Binding, and the first player to decipher their opponent's Words will be victorious.

Scribes will utilize a wide arsenal of powerful god powers and deadly spells, as well as calling upon a team of allies to assist them and conquer the battlefield.

In this race for victory, who will be prevail in the arena and claim the legendary artifact?

147466.name: Capy Fine Racing GP
147466.description:
"Friday kicked off with a hustle to finish the booth, and the launch of the DOUBLE FINE & CAPY VIDEOGAME COLLECTION which included the exclusive game CAPY FINE RACING GP on floppy disk...

The day ended with an official Double Fine + Capy + 2PP celebratory dinner. With oysters....And party we did, all while playing our newly released CAPY FINE RACING GP."

Source: The Publisher Website.

147467.name: DCS: Mi-8MTV2 Magnificent Eight
147467.description:
DCS: Mi-8MTV2 Magnificent Eight focuses on the Mi-8MTV2 – an upgraded version of one of the most widely produced helicopters in history and a combat transport and fire support veteran of countless operations around the world.
Developed by Belsimtek with help from a seasoned Mi-8 pilot, the expert team behind DCS: UH-1H Huey continues to raise the bar in flight and systems modeling.
Key Features:
•Unmatched flight physics providing the most realistic and dynamic conventional helicopter experience on the PC
•Accurate and highly detailed 3D interactive cockpit featuring six-degrees-of-freedom technology compatible with head-tracking devices
•Accurate modeling of the Mi-8MTV2 instruments, weapons, engines, radios, fuel, electrical, and hydraulic systems
•Highly detailed Mi-8MTV2 external 3D model, liveries, and weapons
•Accurate audio environment based on custom Mi-8MTV2 sound samples

Source: The Game Website.

147468.name: Double Fine & Capy Videogame Collection
147468.description:
"As if that weren’t enough, PAX East attendees will be able to purchase an extremely-limited edition DF/Capy Bundle box, containing a Steam download code for all seven games. The team-up will also be commemorated by a special convention-exclusive shirt emblazoned with a rightous mashup of the two studios’ logos and an art print featuring characters from their games."

Source: The Developer Website.

147469.name: Pizza Frenzy
147469.description:
Help the Stromboli family pass
the pizzas in this tasty treat!

Match incoming orders with the right kitchen to deliver fresh pizzas on time to happy customers. Work fast or you’ll miss orders... miss too many and you’ll be out of business!

Source: The Publisher Website.

147470.description:
User Description
Stickers for use on the Walk the Plank! pirate pieces.
147470.name: Walk the Plank! Meeple Stickers

147471.name: Mystical: Kingdom of Monsters (4E)
147471.description:
Publisher's Blurb

A World of great heroes and villainous thieves...

A world of mad kings and young adventurers...

A world of monsters.

Mystical: Kingdom of Monsters brings the joys of capturing and raising companions to a new realm. Pick up and play as one of 154 basic monster characters. Roll up one of 7 new standard trainer classes. Even play as a monstorin and walk your own path. New powers, enemies, feats, magic, and more!

When monster training goes medieval, are you up to the challenge?

147472.description:
This game has been published by dV Giochi as a reward for winning the 2012/2013 edition of the Gioco Inedito – Best Unpublished game contest. Powered by Lucca comics & Games and dV Giochi, the contest aims to identify the best new card game design from all prototypes received and to reward it by publishing the game in a fully professional and high-quality format, overseen directly by dV Giochi. All prototypes submitted must conform to the technical and style requirements, fixed components and a given theme which changes every year. Everybody can join the contest and this is a great opportunity for emerging game designers to see their idea published.
For more information:
giocoinedito@luccacomicsandgames.com
www.luccacomicsandgames.com

The card game Shooting Star is set in a distant galaxy, where ruthless Space Admirals compete to earn the respect of their commander – the Dark Invader himself – by destroying everything that comes into range: starships, meteors, planets...
Do you have what it takes to rise up the ranks and take command of the Dark Invader’s Fleet?
Your goal is to score more points than the others by destroying Planets, capturing Moons, destroying your opponents’ Destruction cards, and completing your own Secret Missions.

It's as easy as 1-2-3:
1. Secretly position your weapons on a planet (by playing your card face down).
2. Reveal your weapon and blast the other planets (by turning your card over).
3. Blast a planet enough and your can capture it! Earn even more points by capturing moons and completing your Secret Mission!

Contents: 110 cards (49 Planets, 45 Destruction cards, 15 Missions, 1 Dark Invader), rules.
147472.name: Shooting Star

147473.description: Malefic Curses, the first expansion for Wiz-War, adds a fifth player to the battle, bringing a new sector board and new portals with him. New schools of magic enter the playing field as well, inviting players to tap the fearful powers of Hexcraft, Necromancy, and Chaos. Hexcraft allows a player to etch powerful runes in the paths of the maze, trapping those who dare to cross them. Necromancy offers a host of death-dealing tactics, and the powers of Chaos grow increasingly powerful, although they remain unpredictable at best.
147473.name: Wiz-War: Malefic Curses

147474.description:
Only a few fighters have made you eat dust. Coincidentally, one of them is standing in front of you right now, ready to fight. Your hands rise into an impenetrable guard. Your time has come to take revenge!

In the fighting game 8 Masters' Revenge, you are a martial arts master and you want to beat your opponents, strike after strike. Your only weapons are your two hands, represented by the two cards you have in play. Find the weak point in your opponent's guard to deal damage to him. As soon as his "health" marker reaches the last space of his life track, he is out of the game. The last surviving player wins the fight!
147474.name: 8 Masters' Revenge

147475.description:
Munchkin Gets Promoted is a 15-card booster pack for use with the Munchkin base game or any other standalone titles in the Munchkin family. This booster contains three new cards – "Billiard Ball of Nonexistence", "Get A Head", and the titular "Get Promoted" – along with a dozen previously released promotional cards that are now out of print, specifically:


Curse! Zombification (From W23 Exclusive Booster 2011, Classic Door Back)
Cut In Line (Promo card, Classic Door Back)
Henchmonster (Promo card, Classic Door Back)
John of the Dead (From W23 Exclusive Booster 2011, Zombies Door Back)
The Last Laugh (Promo card, Classic Door Back)
Love Thy Neighbor (Promo card, Apocalypse Treasure Back)
Mug The Shopkeeper (Promo card, Classic Door Back)
Ranger Hireling (From W23 Exclusive Booster 2011, Classic Door Back)
Stacked Deck (Promo card, Classic Door Back)
Step-And-A-Half (Promo card, Classic Door Back)
Whim of the Elder Gods (Promo card, Cthulhu Promo Back)
Zombie Santa (Promo card, Zombies Door Back)


Of the new cards both Billiard Ball of Nonexistence & Get Promoted are for Classic Munchkin and Get a Head is for Munchkin Zombies
147475.name: Munchkin Gets Promoted

147476.name: Millionenraub
147476.description: A theft at the museum! Even though the museum is crowded with visitors admiring paintings and sculptures of great artists, nobody notices that the exhibition's most famous work of art has been stolen by an unknown thief. A voice sounds from the loudspeakers — "Nobody leaves the building!" — and the player inspectors are suddenly on hand to question visitors and find important clues. An exciting pursuit for the culprit begins in Millionenruab. Who will catch him first?

147477.name: Within Death's Gaze Pathfinder Version
147477.description:
Publisher Blurb

The one that started it all is now available for Pathfinder RPG!

"It's a dark and stormy night as you stumble into the town of Blackbyrne. You seek shelter, but things are not as they seem, will you survive the night?"

Within Death's Gaze is a FREE mini-adventure for 4-6 5th level characters compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying game system. It is offered as a preview to Blackbyrne Publishing's upcoming line of unique adventures!

147478.name: Vulpes
147478.description:
Vulpes is the classical logical game created by Marek Łukaszewicz in 2013. This strategic game for two players is played on the board 8x9 squares.

The game is played by two players.

At the start of the game each player has nine pawns (hunters) and one king (fox). The white chessmen go first. The first move is made by the white king, then a white pawn (two moves), then the black chessmen can make two similar moves.

The aim of the game is to eliminate the opponent's king (fox) from the chessboard, or to block it so that it cannot move.

General rules of the game

It is not possible to jump over the opponent's chessmen.

King (fox) moves vertically, horizontally and diagonally at least two squares at a time. The opponent's king is captured when two kings are on the same line without a single pawn between them. When two kings are on adjoining squares capture is not possible (the king moves at least two squares at a time) and the king is blocked as if by a pawn.

Pawns (hunters)
The pawns (hunters) can move one square at a time in all directions. It is not possible to eliminate the pawns, so the initial number of 9 pawns for each player remains the same for the duration of the game. Pawns may only move onto an empty square.

The winner is the player who eliminates the opponent's king or who blocks it so that it cannot move.

147479.name: Loop Garou
147479.description:
From publisher blurb:

The werewolf came from nowhere, and it killed you. You felt its claws rip through your flesh as the world grew dim. Somehow, due to random chance or Providence, you have a chance to live that night again armed with foreknowledge of the attack. This time it will end differently. And you will see to it that any other monsters in the town will come to an equally sticky end.

147480.name: Leanheart Edge
147480.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Middle Kingdoms have fallen to the Khaganate, the Great Houses ruined and their armies scattered. With help from an unlikely ally, their historical enemy the Empire, the remaining Lords try to rebuild an old fortress. They hope to keep the Khaganate from the EMpire's borders and retake their lost lands. 'Leanheart Edge' is a rules-light role-playing game about rebuilding that castle, with elements of heroic warfare and political intrigue.

147481.name: Planetary Defence Force
147481.description:
From publisher blurb:

You supplemented your colonist's income with a role as a part-time gunship pilot. After all, there was no chance you would ever have to actually fight in the thing. The planet is a backwater, and those jalopies can barely fly. Imagine what a mess it would be if them, and you, were the only things that stood in the way of an invasion by a hostile power. Ha ha. Well, crap.

147482.name: SANTIAGO: A Myth of the Far Future Campaign Guide (Pathfinder)

rpgseries.21995: SANTIAGO: A Myth of the Far Future

147482.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the SANTIAGO: A Myth of the Far Future, a multi-part PATHFINDER adventure path set in a future western-style sci-fi universe. In this campaign, the heroes take on the role of bounty hunters who ﬁnd themselves challenged across eleven adventures spanning levels 1 to 20 in a search for a legendary bandit. They will travel to different worlds, battle outlaws, face off with rival bounty hunters, and encounter alien species. The heroes will also need to forge alliances, however shaky, and gather what information they can in order to succeed.

Consider this guide a gamemaster’s overview of the adventure path. It contains an overview of the entire campaign, setting material, monsters (aliens), and more.

If you are a player, we highly recommend you don’t read this book; it contains spoilers. Any rules material you need is presented in the Santiago Adventure Path Player’s Guide, available separately.

147483.name: A Visit to Keepsake: The Hunt Begins (Pathfinder)

rpgseries.21995: SANTIAGO: A Myth of the Far Future

147483.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the first adventure in the SANTIAGO: A Myth of the Far Future adventure path for the Pathfinder RPG! In this adventure for 1st-level heroes, the PCs hunt down their first bounty, receive information about the greatest outlaw ever to live, and deal with a territorial rival.

SANTIAGO: A Myth of the Far Future is a sci-fi adventure path for the Pathfinder RPGbased on the novels of Mike Resnick. Throughout the course of this AP, the heroes will pursue the notorious intergalactic outlaw Santiago and the 20,000,000 credit bounty on his head. The problem? Nobody knows where the famed criminal is, what he looks like, or how to find him!

The far future awaits as this far future AP blazes new trails across the galaxy!

(Terminology thing you'll see in stat-blocks: a burner is a laser pistol, a screecher is a sonic pistol, and a bludger fires real bullets).

147484.name: A Visit to Keepsake: The Hunt Begins (4E)

rpgseries.21995: SANTIAGO: A Myth of the Far Future

147484.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the first adventure in the SANTIAGO: A Myth of the Far Future adventure path for D&D 4E! In this adventure for 1st-level heroes, the PCs hunt down their first bounty, receive information about the greatest outlaw ever to live, and deal with a territorial rival.

SANTIAGO: A Myth of the Far Future is a sci-fi adventure path for D&D 4E based on the novels of Mike Resnick. Throughout the course of this AP, the heroes will pursue the notorious intergalactic outlaw Santiago and the 20,000,000 credit bounty on his head. The problem? Nobody knows where the famed criminal is, what he looks like, or how to find him!

The far future awaits as this far future AP blazes new trails across the galaxy!

(Terminology thing you'll see in stat-blocks: a burner is a laser pistol, a screecher is a sonic pistol, and a bludger fires real bullets).

147485.name: Exotic Encounters: Couatls
147485.description:
From publisher blurb:

This particular installment of Exotic Encounters focuses on the couatl, a creature that is exotic by almost any definition of the word. From their South American background (which stands out like a sore thumb in the medieval-European-centric world of fantasy roleplaying games), to the fact that few parties have any reason to ever fight one, it’s a fair bet that your game group has never encountered a couatl before. This book aims to provide some couatls that might actually see some use, the first of which is the jet couatl (CR 11), a type of couatl that has fallen from grace and forsaken its heavenly background, as well as its wings, in favor of a variety of new profane powers. Also featured is the primal couatl (CR 13), which is more in tune with the forces of nature than the heavens, and possesses a powerful hypnotic gaze and hallucinogenic venom. Finally, the radiant couatl (CR15) is a paragon of the typical couatl’s ideals, but in addition to being advanced and having better spellcasting, its radiant wings can disable those who gaze upon it, and its blood is a fabled cure-all, giving characters of any stripe a reason to come to blows with one.

147486.name: Burglar
147486.description:
From publisher blurb:

If I say he is a Burglar, a Burglar he is!

Halflings can be more than just simple folk who enjoy the creature comforts of life! With this full 8-level class for Labyrinth Lord (and other old-school fantasy role-playing games), players will be able to confunsicate their foes with riddles, tricks, and a little bit of luck!

147487.name: Sylvan Elf
147487.description:
From publisher blurb:

I feel it in the water, I feel it in the earth...

Not all elves are masters of the arcane. The Sylvan Elf is a new 10-level player character class for Labyrinth Lord and other old school fantasy role-playing games that draws their magic from the very earth itself! This unique blend of elvish traits and druidic magic will draw your game out of the dungeon and into the wilderness!

Note: This product draws on material found in the Labyrinth Lord Advanced Player's Guide. For the purchaser's convenience, this product includes all the supplementary rules necessary to make full use of this class in a game that does not make use of the Advanced Player's Guide.

147488.name: DUNGEON WORLD: Edizione Italiana
147488.description:
From the submitter:
This item is referred to the manual that is going through the crowdfunding campaign at Ulule.

From the product website:

Dungeon World is a world of fantastic adventure. A world of magic, gods, demons, Good and Evil. Brave heroes venture into the most dangerous corners of the land in search of gold and glory. You are those heroes. You go where others can't or won't. You conquer the unbeatable and laugh in the face of Death. There are monstrous things lurking in the world. Are you ready to face them?

147490.name: Roolipelaaja (Issue 17 - Sep 2008)
147490.description:
The theme of this issue is ninjas.

It also has interviews with the guests of honor of Ropecon 2008 Greg Stolze and Chris Pramas and a choose-your-own-adventure type of solo scenario about murder of shogun.

147491.name: Might & Magic VI: The Mandate of Heaven Limited Edition

videogamehonor.29630: 1999 D.I.C.E. Best Role-Playing Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)

videogamecompilation.71187: Might and Magic I: The Secret of the Inner Sanctum

147491.description:
"A Limited Edition version of the game was also released, including a cloth map of Enroth, a strategy guide and the first five games of the series on CD-ROM."

Source: Wikipedia, "Might and Magic VI: The Mandate of Heaven - Limited Edition", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

"Might and Magic VI: The Mandate of Heaven – Special Edition (1998), included Might and Magic games I, II, III, IV, V and the fanmade Swords of Xeen as well."

Source: Wikipedia, "Might and Magic VI: The Mandate of Heaven - Special Edition", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

147493.name: Catachresis: A Way Too Scary Game
147493.description:
When Jeff, noted ghostologist, is called in late one night, he knows that he has a job to do. What he doesn't know is that this job is the most important one he's ever had. As the night goes on, the stakes increase, and when the deadwinds rise and the lights go out, Jeff might be the only person between humans and their total extinction.
History
The past few years have seen a rapid increase in the number of horror games being released. While Amnesia: The Dark Descent has spawned an entire genre of first person games about being scared, 2D side-scrolling horror games are still relatively rare. Cameron Kunzelman saw this field, played 2D horror games like Home and Lone Survivor, and decided that he wanted to go another way. He then mocked up the game in Construct 2 and then launched a kickstarter for $125. After a month he had raised over $1300 to develop the game. Over the next two months he created Catachresis: A Way Too Scary game, and the final product is an intense horror/comedy mashup influenced equally by Hugo's House of Horrors, Ghostbusters, Shirley Jackson, Event Horizon, the comics work of Mike Mignola, and Julia Kristeva.
Features

More than 45 minutes of horror gameplay punctuated by comedy.
A brilliant dark ambient soundtrack by Anatra
The violence of duration and a sick feeling in your gut.
Simple 2D gameplay.

Source: The Game Website.

147495.name: Wunderwerk (Print issue 1 - Jun 2008)
147495.description:
First (and only) Wunderwerk issue availalbe in print before publication was switched entirely to pdf. It came with issue 129 of Aventurischer Bote.

Contents:
- Das Grauen im All ("(The) Horror in space", Space Gothic primer)
- Space Gothic comic strip
- Ausgelöscht ("obliterated", Space Gothic short story)
- Haie am Horizont ("Sharks on the Horizon", Armalion updates)
- Truant Spiele news
- Aventurien alleine erforschen ("Exploring Aventurien Solo", information on the design process of a Schwarze Auge solo adventure)
- Iron Kingdoms and Urban War news

boardgameimplementation.122327: Pirates of the Spanish Main: Shuffling the Deck

147498.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Take control of powerful Jaegers and defend the people of Earth from the devastation of the Kaiju!

Under the shadow of the Kaiju attacks, the Jaegers and their pilots are a source of inspiration for the people and a symbol of hope. Secretly take control of Jaeger pilots and lead them to gain fame in the eyes of the people as you defend the cities of the world from the destruction caused by the Kaiju. But even in the heat of battle, there is always room for some friendly competition.

In the Pacific Rim: Shuffling the Deck card game, each player secretly controls characters from the movie that are piloting Jaegers. Each turn, a Kaiju attack card will be executed — awarding fame as the Jaegers repel the attack, causing the Jaegers to take damage or causing the Jaegers to lose fame if the Kaiju manage to beat them back. The players use movement cards to get their pilots into the best position for the current Kaiju attack. The players who gain the most fame will win the game when all of the Kaiju attack cards run out.

Players can guess other player's secret characters which will award them half of the fame that pilot has gained throughout the game. The player with the most fame wins!
147498.name: Pacific Rim: Shuffling the Deck

147499.name: Desktop Arcade Ball
147499.description:
Players take turns launching a metal ball with a sprint loaded rod up a ramp and into one of the holes beyond. Each hole is labeled with point values ranging from 10 to 50. After 10 shots by each player, the highest score win. A perfect game is 500 points. Players can play on teams or cooperatively to try to beat the high score.

The skill of the game is primarily in how far back you pull the launcher, and thus how much force is applied. A little looseness in the launching mechanism also permits a small amount of additional control.

147500.name: Obelisk
147500.description:
Obelisk is a 2 player game that is played on the spaces of a 7x7 board.

48 Reversi/Othello pieces and a single white piece, known as the Obelisk is all that is needed.

Objective
Last player to make a valid move on his turn wins.

Definitions
Adjacent from now on means, orthogonally and diagonally adjacent.

Play
The Obelisk is placed at the center of the board at start.

Decide who goes first.

Players have 2 moves per turn, but may do one of two actions per move.

1.Place a reversi piece white side up on an empty adjacent space to the Obelisk and then move the Obelisk away from the placed reversi piece a queens move any distance across the board, so long as the move also ends on an empty space or

2.Place a reversi piece white side up on an empty space that is in line of sight with the Obelisk and then moving the Obelisk like a queens move, adjacent to that placed reversi piece, so long as the move also ends on an empty space.

Note and restrictions

•The Obelisk when moving, may travel over any number of white faced reversi pieces, but in doing so must flip over all those pieces to their black sides.

•The Obelisk may not travel over any black faced pieces.

The game ends when a player on her turn is unable to place a reversi piece and move the Obelisk, making her opponent the winner.

147003.name: Colossal Cave Adventure: The Card Game
147003.description:
Colossal Cave Adventure: The Card Game is based on the 350-point ADVENT computer game created by Will Crowther and expanded by Don Woods. As that game is in the public domain, this adaption is placed in the public domain as well.

The game captures the spirit of the first text adventure: the feel of exploring, mapping, and navigating a new world, while trying to find the items that will solve the puzzles.

To setup, you deal location cards face down to form 3 levels of the cave: each level is a 5 by 5 grid. The entrance chamber is placed in the center of the first level and players' pawns start there.

From a location card, players can only travel in directions indicated by the location, moving to one permitted adjacent card and exploring that location. Sometimes they encounter obstacles ("A fierce green snake bars the way!") and have to turn back unless they have the current item; typically they encounter new regions of the cave ("You are in a maze of twisty little passages, all alike. [Lose a turn!]"), some of which allow them to choose from an item deck ("There is a shiny brass lamp nearby"). The cave is confusing and complex - often you can't simply return to a location you recently left, but must plot a course through other regions or levels to get there. Magic words will take you up and down levels of the cave.

To win, players race to be the first to score 100 points in items collected and puzzles solved or solve the end game puzzle before anyone else.

147004.name: Hop
147004.description:
Hop is an abstract strategy game with simple rules and generic material. An 8x8 board, 16 black and 16 white stones is all you need.

Starting with your stones on the first 2 lines of your side of the board your goal is to move one of your stones to the opponent's end. To get there stones can only move by jumping vertically or horizontally over at least one adjacent stone (or a row of stones) of any color composition onto the next free field. But be careful! Finding the right balance between offense and defense is key. Because whenever you don't jump forward on your turn, your opponent may say "Hop", forcing you to a second move that MUST be forward. But using the "Hop" rule in the right moment yourself can free the way to victory!

Find the complete rules in the Files section.

147005.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 109 - Sep 1984)
147005.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #109
September 1984

Cover art by David Dunham.

147006.name: Dungeon Crawl (Issue 2 - Spring 2013)
147006.description:
User Summary:

This is the second issue of Wayne Rossi's "zine for classic dungeon fantasy roleplaying games."

147007.name: Dungeon Crawl (Issue 1 - March 2012)
147007.description:
User Summary:

This is the first issue of Wayne Rossi's "zine for classic dungeon fantasy roleplaying games."

147009.description:
Zombies are moving into the cemetery close to your home. Unfortunately, none of the parents believe you or your friends, so you decide to take matters into your own hands...

In the cooperative children's game Zombie Kidz, players work to stop the zombies from taking over the cemetery by either locking the gates or eliminating the zombies. The game rules can be adapted to increase the difficulty level.
147009.name: Zombie Kidz

147010.name: Ishar Compilation
147010.description:
User Summary

This title includes the 3 Ishar titles as well as the precursor to the Ishar trilogy, namely:

Crystals of Arborea,
Ishar: Legend of the Fortress,
Ishar 2: Messengers of Doom, and
Ishar 3: The Seven Gates of Infinity

147011.name: Archangel (2002)
147011.description:
User Summary

In Archangel, you play the role of Michael Travinsky. After having a car accident, you are given a quest by the Lord of Light. You are to visit the middle ages, then traverse into the year 2039 and, finally, explore the realm of darkness so as to decide the fate of humanity. You receive the ancient Sword of Light and your adventure begins...

147012.name: Jowood RPG Compilation
147012.description:
User Summary

This compilation includes three RPG titles previously released by Jowood. They are:

Archangel,
Arx Fatalis, and
Gorasul: L'Heritage Du Dragon

147013.name: Star Assault
147013.description:
User Summary

The Sparks, an evil alien species, are out to conquer the universe. You control a spaceship through 30 action packed levels of shooting Spark spaceships and foiling their plans. There are various objectives you must complete on every level before you can move on to the next. You need to gain experience and upgrade your ship as much as possible to stand a chance against the Sparks, as they get stronger on every level.

147014.name: The Gentleman
147014.description:
User Summary

In the Gentleman you try to open the doors. This gentleman has some peculiarities. He does not like to get wet, or touch anything beneath his station. Gravity may not effect him they way you expect, and he always has his trusty umbrella. While he prefers to eschew violence he will not hesitate to defend himself when the situation calls. Try to get through each level as quickly as possible. Solve the puzzles and move on to the next or work toward faster times.

147015.name: Monopoly: Go
147015.description:
This is a miniature, portable edition of Monopoly. The board is roughly 3/4 the size of a normal monopoly board and is stored in a miniature case. There are several clips so that the game state can be saved and preserved without the pieces scattering. The game design is really geared towards portability and the ability to play the game in several segments of time.

Components

Compact Gameboard
6 movers
6 location clips
6 money clips
28 Title Deed cards
16 Chance cards
16 Community Chest cards
1 pack of MONOPOLY money
32 house clips
12 hotel clips
2 dice
Instructions

147017.name: Moocho Sudooko
147017.description:
The goal of Moocho Sudooko is to be the player with the most tiles on the board and the least amount left in your pile.

Players place tiles by rolling two D6 and the adding, subtracting, multiplying or dividing the two results to get a number between 1 and 9. The player then places the tile on the board, a 9 by 9 grid representing a sudoku board. Tiles must be placed such that they don't break the rules of sudoku. The game ends when no possible legal move can be made (whether or not the puzzle is completed).

147018.name: Eine Reise durch das Märchenland
147018.description:
Objective: be the first reaching finish space (field 24) -
learn more about fairy tales
- moving by turns/'Roll & Move' game
each player rolls the die & moves; ending on any space ==> follow instructions printed on lid inside
remarks:
published early 1950's

147019.name: Glocken-Hütchen
147019.description:
Objective: Be the first completing a set of bells

Each player draws a card with five coloured shapes of bells, getting a wooden fishing pole with a little hook at the end of the fishing cord.
The players sit around a cardboard, filled with wooden bells, with a small ring on top; they have to try fishing appropiate bells from the ground simultaneously.
The first one placing all matching bells onto his card wins the game.

boardgamehonor.26774: 2014 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee

147020.description:
Star Realms is a spaceship combat deck-building game by Magic Hall of Famers Darwin Kastle (The Battle for Hill 218) and Rob Dougherty (Ascension Co-designer).

Star Realms is a fast paced deck-building card game of outer space combat. It combines the fun of a deck-building game with the interactivity of Trading Card Game style combat. As you play, you make use of Trade to acquire new Ships and Bases from the cards being turned face up in the Trade Row from the Trade Deck. You use the Ships and Bases you acquire to either generate more Trade or to generate Combat to attack your opponent and their bases. When you reduce your opponent’s score (called Authority) to zero, you win!

Multiple decks of Star Realms and/or Star Realms: Colony Wars, one for every two people, allows up to six players to play a variety of scenarios.


Factions

Each of the cards in the 80 card Trade Deck is a Ship or a Base belonging to one of four factions: The Trade Federation, The Blobs, The Star Empire or The Machine Cult.


Trade Federation

In the far future, the more traditional governing bodies of the human race have been replaced with corporate leadership. The earth and its surrounding colonies are ruled by a group of corporations called the Trade Federation. The Federation’s policies are focused around trade and growth, but especially in profit and prosperity for those at the top of the corporate ladder. While they prefer to deal with other star realms using trade and diplomacy, they have a large defense branch dedicated to protecting the Federation’s trade and other interests.


The Blobs

These mysterious creatures are the first alien life forms encountered by the human race. Most of the initial encounters consisted of human colonies being completely obliterated. On the few occasions that a Blob ship has been recovered somewhat intact, the only biological remains found inside have consisted of a gelatinous mass, thus leading to the moniker, “The Blobs”. While for several years all encounters between humanity and the Blobs have been extremely violent, there is currently some limited trade between various Blob factions and some of the more daring human traders.The Blobs are best at generating massive amounts of Combat and at removing undesirable cards from the Trade Row.


Star Empire

The Star Empire consists primarily of former colonies of the Trade Federation. These colonies were on the outer edges of the Federation. Not only did they feel used by the corporations, but they felt the Federation failed to give them adequate protection from the Blobs. As a result, one ambitious colonial governor was able to unite several colonies into an independent empire under his control, one with a strong military, both for warding off the Blobs and for discouraging the Federation from trying to reclaim their lost colonies. The Star Empire is a combat oriented faction that draws lots of cards and makes the opponent discard cards.


Machine Cult

A cluster of industrial mining worlds were completely cut off from the Trade Federation by the Blobs. With the threat of annihilation by the Blobs always looming and no contact with the rest of human space, these worlds were forced to take drastic measures. Soon a cult of technology arose, focused on using advanced technology, robotics and computerization to create strong defenses and a powerful military that belied their relatively small population. Since their leaders believed their salvation lay in technology, technology soon became their god and their religion. The Machine Cult gains most of its power from being able to remove undesirable cards from your deck and from having a large number of Bases designed to defend your Authority from attack.


Playing Star Realms

​When you play Star Realms, you will be able to acquire and use Ships and Bases of any and all of the four factions. Many cards have powerful Ally abilities that reward you for using Ships and Bases of the same faction together, however.

As you acquire cards using Trade, you put them into your discard pile, to be later shuffled into your personal deck. When you draw Ships, you do what they say and they get placed into your discard pile at the end of your turn. When you draw a Base, you play it face up in front of you and may use its abilities once every turn. In addition to Combat being the way you reduce your opponent’s Authority to zero and win the game, it’s also useful for destroying your opponent’s Bases. Some Bases are designated as Outposts. Your opponent’s Outposts must be destroyed before you can use Combat to attack your opponent’s Authority directly.

Star Realms is easy to learn, especially if you’re familiar with deck-building games, but it’s a game that takes time to master. Each time you play, the game is filled with various strategic decision points. Should I take the best card for me or the best card for my opponent? Should I focus on taking cards of a particular faction or on taking the best card available? Should I be focusing on acquiring more Trade or more Combat? Should I attack my opponent’s Base or their Authority? These are just some of the many choices you’ll be faced with. New players needn’t agonize over these choices just to play, but as they become more advanced players, they will find this depth of strategy leads to great replayability.
147020.name: Star Realms

boardgameaccessory.167751: Star Realms: Battlecruiser Alternate Art Promo Card

147021.description:
In the movie-making game Hollywood, each player is a studio boss who tries to produce the most successful blockbuster. Players construct movies from game cards that they draft or purchase. Players compete to get the most popular stars to perform in their movies because this brings them more money and more Hollywood Awards (which are pictured on some cards).

First, players take turns choosing cards with the aid of drafting. Second, players purchase additional star cards (the strongest cards in the game) at the auction. Third, each player uses his nine cards in hand to make one or several movies. A movie must have a minimum of three cards: a Script, a Director and an Actor (or Actress). Additional cast members are optional, but they add to a movie's total box office. Quality films bring a large amount of profit to the player.

Players go through three production years, then after the third year Hollywood Awards bring extra money to the players, and the richest player wins.
147021.name: Hollywood

147022.name: Mementos: Crafting with Luck
147022.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everybody's got a lucky item. For some people, it's a lucky coin. For others, it's an old engagement ring they keep on a chain. And for some, it's the bullet that barely missed their heart. These items have significance to the individual, and that significance weaves the item with the person's luck. Some people see the importance these items play, and they learn to manipulate people's luck. They call these items mementos.

This is the first spirit-based crafting skill released for Tephra: the Steampunk RPG. It includes 7 new Luck specialties and 48 new augments.

147023.name: Explosives
147023.description:
From publisher blurb:

No adventure is complete without destroying a few buildings, burning an airship to a crisp, and blasting your way through a couple doors. In fact, with the proper application of explosives, what can’t you do?

Open up Explosives, a 32 page supplement to the science skill in which not only are you going to get more explosive augments than you’ll ever need, you’ll find new ways to use them, new items to pair them up with, and even whole new ways to craft them. And we don’t stop there, you’ll also get to enjoy the BombRats, a devilishly destructive group of sky pirates excited to ruin your adventurers’ day.

147024.name: In Residence
147024.description:
From publisher blurb:

The troubled youths of Aldamiir are in peril. Inside an old asylum, a mad proprietress is advancing medical science through inhumane and dark experimentation. The adventurers must be brave enough to enter this asylum, free the children, and fend off the worst of her depraved experiments.

This is a 3-5 hour adventure for first level adventurers for Tephra: the Steampunk RPG.

147025.name: Der Grosse Western Treck
147025.description:
Der Grosse Western Treck is a roll-and-move game, where players attempt to be the first to reach the target space. Each turn, a player rolls the die and moves that many spaces forward. If he ends on a special space, some event occurs.

Produced by Ravensburger.

147026.name: Demons
147026.description:
From publisher blurb:


A magnificient mythic monster manual!

The first volume in our new Mythic Monsters series, Mythic Monsters: Demons brings you a dozen and one demonic terrors to torment your PCs! Twelve of your favorite demons are here, updated for the mythic rules, and when we say updated we mean complete stat blocks, yes, but more than that every demon has its own unique and exciting new mythic abilities, from a balor's shadow and flame to a mythic succubus' dark mistress. From the insidious quasit to the lordly balor, the reeking hezrou to the stealthy soul-devouring shadow demon, this product covers CRs from 2 to 25. There are demons that will tear your body apart and demons that will seduce and subvert all that is good and true, including mythic versions of the incubus and succubus. On top of a dozen demons you already know, Mythic Monsters: Demons introduces a brand-new addition to the Abyssal arsenal, the titanic two-headed gulgerak, a demonic war machine that will have your PCs running for their lives. As if 13 demons were not enough, Mythic Monsters: Demons also contains rules for playing mythic demons with extra flair, including breaching planar walls, demonic bargains, and demonic possession!

The Mythic Monsters series from Legendary Games brings you dynamic and exciting mechanics alongside evocative and cinematic new abilities that really help creatures live up to their flavor text, whether they are creatures of real-world myth and legend or creatures born out of the RPG tradition itself. These creatures can work just as well in a non-mythic campaign as they do in one that incorporates the full mythic rules, as you can throw them at your jaded players who think they've seen it all or know the standard monster stats as well as you do. That look of surprise and "What was THAT?" will warm any GM's heart.

147028.name: Steamroller
147028.description:
User Summary:

Steamroller was a game for ColecoVision by David Rolfe. It was ment to be released by Activion in 1984, but because of the videogame crash it wasn't released until 2000 by Retrotopia.

The aim of the game is to clean streets from bouncing heads with your Steamroller. When all the streets are clean, you go on to the next level. The levels are seen from above. There is also another steamroller in the game. If you crash with the other steamroller, or drive into a bomb, you lose a life.

160352.name: World of Tanks: Rush 2 - Second Front

boardgamecompilation.197996: World of Tanks: Rush – Deluxe Edition

147030.description:
The deck-building card game World of Tanks: Rush is based on the World of Tanks online game, uses the same terminology as that game, and has been illustrated by the same artists.

In World of Tanks: Rush you are given the role of a tank squad commander, and you lead your tanks into battle, defend your bases, call for reinforcements, and receive medals. The main idea of the game, which uses simple deck-building principles, is to strategically select cards from the hundreds available to form a strong squad. The goal of the game is to earn more medals than everybody else, and you can earn a medal three ways:


One medal for destroying an enemy vehicle.
Three medals for destroying an enemy base.
Five medals for the end-of-game achievement.
147030.name: World of Tanks: Rush

147031.name: Ahoi Saale abwärts!
147031.description:
Ahoi Saale abwärts! is a roll-and-move game, where players attempt collect the most points before reaching the Elbe river. Each turn, a player rolls the die and moves that many spaces forward. If he ends on a special space, some event occurs. If he ends on a (red) victory point space, he collects one victory point.

Produced by Ravensburger; published during 1950's.

147032.name: Life's a Beach
147032.description:
Life’s a Beach is a tactical game in which you try to corner the market for deckchairs on your local beach. Families of varying size and requirements will visit the beach and you will have to compete for their custom. Where is the best place to pitch your umbrella? Should you move your boat further along the coast? Do you want to erect your windbreak now or later? Or will you resort to other tactics, such as collapsing and removing your rival's beach furniture? And don’t forget to use that space you reserved early with your towel...

Game play is simple. On your turn you either player 2 cards or draw 2 cards. If you play two identical cards, you can take their common action three times. If you play two different cards, you can take their respectives actions once each. Or you can discard any two cards to take any one action of your choice.

Actions include: pitching, moving, or erecting a deckchair, umbrella, windbreak, or boat; collapsing or removing a rival's deckchair, umbrella, windbreak, or boat; walking a family across the beach; or placing your towel down to reserve that space for later use. The play who manages these actions best wilns the game.

147033.name: Galaxy
147033.description:
Galaxy is an 'Invent your own game' game by Fred Horn. It's a 100-card deck of custom playing cards with which you can design your own game.

The deck consists of the following:

- 2 'saturn cards'
- 2 'comet cards'
- 6 sets of 16 cards (96 total). Each of these cards show a combinations of 2 numbers in 2 different colors.

The colors used are red, white, yellow and blue and each has a different celestial body associated with it. Red is Mars, white is the moon, yellow is the sun and blue is the earth.

The combinations used are the following:
white and yellow
white and blue
white and red
blue and red
red and yellow
yellow and blue

Each set of 16 cards is made up of the following (matrix):
- 4 cards showing the sequence: 1/1 - 1/2 - 1/3 - 1/4
- 4 cards showing the sequence: 2/1 - 2/2 - 2/3 - 2/4
- 4 cards showing the sequence: 3/1 - 3/2 - 3/3 - 3/4
- 4 cards showing the sequence: 4/1 - 4/2 - 4/3 - 4/4
with the digits to the left of the slash always being the same color. The digits to the right of the slash as also all in the same color, but always a different color than the digit on the left (see the color combinstion mentioned earlier).

Besides these 100 cards there are also 9 white/blank cards as well as a card showing some details about the game and its designer.

147034.name: Minor Powers
147034.description:
From publisher blurb:

Minor infernal powers are the weakest immortal powers of the Darkness; an intermediate rank between major powers and Dark mortals. Minor powers are often ambitious and seek to improve their position through service to their masters and the destruction of their rivals.

Creatures of Darkness Vol 2: Minor Powers is the second in a series of monsters to be offered for the Rogue Mage game.

147035.name: Double Up
147035.description:
In the card and dice game Double Up, you set the challenge. Do you play it safe and choose a challenge that’s easy for both you and your opponents? Or do you raise the bar and pick a tough one, betting your friends will fail where you’ll succeed?

The starting player attempts to match a pattern on a card using a specified number of dice and a hand of roll modifying cards. The player has a fixed number of attempts and dice, as indicated on the card, to successfully complete the challenge. If successful, the rest of the players must attempt the same challenge card and beat it in as many or fewer attempts than the original player. If the player fails to beat the challenge, whoever set the challenge gains a point; if the challenge is a Double Up card, however, they gain two points. The challenge is over once each player has made an attempt. The next player starts a new challenge and the game continues until one person reaches an agreed upon number of points. Double Up your opponents often to win!

147036.name: QS Asteroids

videogameversion.217726: English/European ZX81 (Full picture cover with text) edition

147036.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Asteroids.




From the inlay:

You are the only person who has flown the Svlegian Raider. You sit back, the seat moulds around you and you blast towards the alien asteroids.

Suddenly they are upon you, you thrust at them, dodging, swerving and firing Phaser Beams at them. They come at you again and again. Still you fire, wiping them from the skies...

You keep firing as they drift towards Nolveg, you fire again...

User summary:

This game is loosely based on the arcade classic "Asteroids", though it does not feature flying saucers, just the eponymous Asteroids.

Like many Quicksilva games for the ZX81, the game is provided with a list of POKEs which can be used to modify parameters such as the number of lives and at which level bonus points are scored, etc.

On the basic ZX81, the player's ship is represented by a number. The number indicates in which direction the ship is facing. 0 indicates straight up, 1 indicates diagonally up and right, 2 indicates right, etc. Asteroids are represented by blocks.

However those with a QS Character Board peripheral could load alternative characters in place of the ZX81s standard character set. Some editions of this game included an additional file with characters representing the player ship facing in each of the 8 directions, and detailed graphics for the asteroids.

The outside of the inlay states "For the ZX-81 with 16K RAM" however the instructions state that the basic game "consists of 3K of Machine Code".

147038.name: QS Invaders
147038.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Space Invaders.




From the inlay:

You fingers play over the studs as you dodge the bombs dropping from the Invaders and fire back destroying the attacking force. The Invaders drop towards you, a glowing saucer, operations centre of the alien fleet floats over the attacking aliens and you fire ... The battle rages on...

User summary:

This game is a clone of the arcade classic "Space Invaders".

Like many Quicksilva games for the ZX81, the game is provided with a list of POKEs which can be used to modify parameters such as the number of Bases, points per Invader destroyed, etc.

The game can take advantage of either or both of two Quicksilva peripherals. A QS Character Board was a peripheral which allowed alternative characters in place of the ZX81s standard character set. These could then be used to display alternative shapes as graphics rather than using letters, numbers and simple blocks to make up the display. The other was the QS Sound Board. The standard ZX81 had no sound output, the QS Sound Board provided audio output for the game.

The outside of the inlay states "For the ZX-81 with 16K RAM" however the instructions state that the basic game requires a minimum of only 7K RAM.

147039.name: Larceny
147039.description:
Larceny is a heist-themed party game for 3+ players. Gather your crew, pick the Score and plan your heist!

Each round one player is the Chief, everyone else is the Crew. The Chief draws a Score from the deck. This card is what the Crew is stealing during the heist. The Chief then draws two Catches, which are problems that crop up during the heist.

The Crew now has to play Fix cards from their hand to try to over come the Catches. Once everyone has played a Fix on each Catch, the Chief decides which Fix is the best, and points are awarded. Next round someone else is the Chief, and play continues.

Larceny has numerous variant gameplay modes. Most notable are the versus Troubleshooters mode, the cooperative Heist mode, the strategic planning Black Bag mode, and the narrative Best Laid Plan mode.

147040.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 110 - Oct 1984)
147040.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #110
October 1984

Cover art by Martin Wixted.

147042.name: Space Unlimited Compilation
147042.description:
User Summary

A compilation of four highly successful science fiction games:

Star Assault,

Galactic Civilization II Ultimate,

Darkstar One,

Sins of a Solar Empire.

147043.name: Black Isle Compilation Part Two
147043.description:
User Summary

An RPG compilation containing over 1200 hours of gameplay. It contains the following great games and expansions:

Baldur's Gate and Baldur's Gate - Tales of the Sword Coast,

Baldur's Gate II and Baldur's Gate II - Throne of Bhaal,
Icewind Dale and Icewind Dale - Heart of Winter,

Icewind Dale II

147045.name: Mechanik: Lernquiz Physik
147045.description:
Mechanics - Physics learning trivia.

With this trivia game students can test how well they have mastered the basic knowledge on the topic and how far they have understood the key concepts of this area of physics.
For each task there are four answers to choose from - but only one is correct. Which answer is correct (and why), is shown on the backside of the card. Each player plays one of the four answer card: A,B,C or D, and all players reveal these simultanously. Then the trivia card is turned around as well to check the correct answer. Each correct answer scores a point. Player with the most points after the deck is exhausted is the winner.

147046.name: Stoffeigenschaften: Lernquiz Chemie
147046.description:
Material properties - Chemistry lerning trivia.

With this trivia game students can test how well they have mastered the basic knowledge on the topic and how far they have understood the key concepts of this area of chemistry.
For each task there are four answers to choose from - but only one is correct. Which answer is correct (and why), is shown on the backside of the card. Each player plays one of the four answer card: A,B,C or D and all players reveal these simultanously. Then the trivia card is turned around as well to check the correct answer. Each correct answer scores a point. Player with the most points after the deck is exhausted is the winner.

147047.name: Der Mensch: Stoffwechsel & Körperbau – Lernquiz Biologie
147047.description:
Human: Metabolism & Body - Biology lerning trivia.

With this trivia game students can test how well they have mastered the basic knowledge on the topic and how far they have understood the key concepts of this area of biology.
For each task there are four answers to choose from - but only one is correct. Which answer is correct (and why), is shown on the backside of the card. Each player plays one of the four answer card: A,B,C or D and all players reveal these simultanously. Then the trivia card is turned around as well to check the correct answer. Each correct answer scores a point. Player with the most points after the deck is exhausted is the winner.

147048.name: Der Mensch: Nerven, Hormone und Fortpflanzung – Lernquiz Biologie
147048.description:
Human: nerves, hormones and reproduction - Biology lerning trivia.

With this trivia game students can test how well they have mastered the basic knowledge on the topic and how far they have understood the key concepts of this area of biology.
For each task there are four answers to choose from - but only one is correct. Which answer is correct (and why), is shown on the backside of the card. Each player plays one of the four answer card: A,B,C or D, and all players reveal these simultanously. Then the trivia card is turned around as well to check the correct answer. Each correct answer scores a point. Player with the most points after the deck is exhausted is the winner.

147049.name: Word Whimsy Bonus Cards
147049.description: Six bonus cards that expand the base game. No question cards, only answers. Made available to publishers.

147050.name: Harkinta-peli
147050.description:
From rules (translated):

In Harkinta-peli (Consideration) you play with differences: shapes, colors, sizes and thicknesses. Each play tile has their own special properties and each property gives one point. No tile is exactly the same as another. In this game a child can learn with an adult to see the differences in the tiles and in which way a tile differs from one or more other tiles.

Observation capabilities develop and after a few rehearse tries the player is able to pick out the best place for a tile on the board so that it differs as much as possible from the previous tiles, at the same time making it harder for the other players to find good placements, thus keeping them from gaining points.

In this game you have to think forward, plan your next move and rethink your moves when your opponents do not play a tile that would've given the most points.

(Year published is a guess based on picture)

147051.name: High School Video Game: The Video Game High School Video Game
147051.description:
User Summary

In Season 2, Episode 3 of the Web series Video Game High School, the character Ki creates a video game based on the Season 1 exploits of the main character, Brian.

The amount of art created for the in-universe video game was such that the show crew decided to release a real-world version of it. Thus they teamed up with Newgrounds to create a full version of High School Video Game: The Video Game High School Video Game.

The game follows the overall story arc of the first season of the series, in which Brian becomes accepted at the prestigious VGHS but runs afoul of trouble with resident hotshot, The Law. The story progresses via several minigames, spanning multiple genres.

147052.description:
First distributed at BashCon 2013

Whenever your Mage summons a creature, he may place it in Summoning Circle's zone instead of his own zone, regardless of range or LoS.
147052.name: Mage Wars: Summoning Circle Promo Card

147053.name: Mage Wars: Hurl Rock Promo Card

147054.description: Mage gains a Defense. Whenever this Defense successfully avoids an attack, Spiked Buckler's attack gains the Counterstrike trait until the end of that attack sequence.
147054.name: Mage Wars: Spiked Buckler Promo Card

147055.description:
First distribution Origins 2013

Mage gains Life +4.

Card Number MWPROMO7
147055.name: Mage Wars: Elfric's Life Ring Promo Card

147056.name: Marvel Avengers:  Captain America vs. Loki

boardgameversion.217764: Briarpatch Sculpted Captain America Clip-on Mini Game

147056.description:
Use up all your cards to win in an epic battle between Captain America and Loki.

There are 4 types of cards: Captain America cards and Loki cards are numbered 1-5, there are also switch cards and wild cards.

Players are dealt 5 cards and the first player selects a card to play, then players take turns playing 1 card. If a Captain America card was played previously, the next card played must be a Captain America card with a higher number. If a Loki card was played previously a Loki card with a lower number must be played. You can play a Loki card on a Captain America or vice versa if the numbers on both are the same.

A wild card can be played at any time. When a wild card is played that player plays a second card of their choice. The switch card can also be played at any time. This card changes play from Loki or Captain America to the opposite character. The next player may then play any value of the new character card.

If a player cannot play a card they draw a card. If the drawn card is playable it can be played otherwise it goes in the player's hand. The first player to play all their cards wins.

147057.name: Marvel Avengers: Hulk's Smashing Challenge

boardgameversion.217765: Mini Game with Backpack Clip-on edition

147057.description:
Put your keen eyes and reflexes to the test. Smash your way to victory! Collect the most "Target" cards by smashing (slapping) the right cards to win.

Game contains 10 Target cards and 38 Smash cards. The Target cards tell you what to smash.

On your turn flip over a card from the Target deck for all to see. Then take the Smash deck into your hand and flip over Smash cards one at a time, forming a discard pile in the middle.

All the other players look for the right card to "smash" (slap). The first player to smash the right card wins the Target card and the turn passes to the next player. Continue until all the Target cards have been claimed. The player with the most Target cards plus Hulk Fists wins.

(2-player variant included)

147058.name: Marvel Avengers: Iron Man Armor Up

boardgameversion.217766: Sculpted Iron Man Collectible Case with Backpack Clip-on edition

147058.description:
Harness the power of Iron Man's Repulsor technology and battle against Loki the trickster! Be the first player to use all your cards to win.

There are 7 types of cards—Iron Man's Energy Shield, Repulsor Blast, or Flight cards, the Avengers cards, the Tesseract and Counter Attack cards, and the Loki cards.

On your turn play one card from your hand following the rules for that card. If you are unable to play any card, you must draw a card and end your turn. Continue playing until one player has used all their cards.

147059.name: Spheres of Power
147059.description:
from the Kickstarter blurb

Spheres of Power is a completely new magic system usable with Pathfinder and other D20 fantasy games. Rather than simply being a new way to access the old system (spell levels, spells per day, spell slots, etc.,) Spheres of Power reworks everything from the ground up, giving players and GMs a talent-based magic system that provides everything they need to explore whole new settings and characters.

Paizo Blurb
Spheres of Power is a completely new magic system for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, built from the ground up to provide an easy and intuitive approach to concept-based magic. From metal-ingesting casters to element benders and beyond, Spheres of Power contains everything players and GMs need to bring a multiplicity of concepts to life through a system of at-will abilities, talent-based magic, and a ki-like system of Spell Points.

This full colored and illustrated book contains everything you need to run the Spheres of Power system which can run alongside the standard magic system or completely replace it. This makes Spheres of Power easily translatable to a multiplicity of worlds and even gaming systems without the need of any other volume.

Included in this book you will find:


20 magic spheres, including alteration, creation, conjuration, dark, death, destruction, divination, enhancement, fate, illusion, life, light, mind, nature, protection, telekinesis, time, war, warp, and weather
11 new base classes, including the thaumaturge, the elementalist, the mageknight, the armorist, the occultist, the eliciter, the soul weaver, the fey adept, the symbiat, the hedgewitch, and the shifter
Advanced magic, including rituals, spellcrafting, advanced talents, item creation, and incantations
Casting traditions, allowing both players and GMs to customize not only their characters, but even the entire concept of magic for their game
Dozens of new feats
Dozens of new magic items
NPCs for every new class to spark ideas or drop into a game
Guilds and Organizations to sprinkle throughout your world
Sample worlds, ready to play or to provide guidelines for adapting Spheres of Power to a plethora of settings and world ideas
And more!

147060.name: Pearl Harbor Attack Thunderfish Torpedo Strike
147060.description:
Tired of small gaming counters, sluggish play processes, or the mindless arcade play of many computer war games? Want more realism, direct action play, and observable battle results without losing the lively historic qualities. Historians and gamers will find the game pace, play method, and varied outcomes to be fascinating. Parents, teachers, and students will recognize the great advantage of learning while playing.

This game is part of a larger "Re-enactment Guide" for the attack on Pearl Harbor.

In this gane, you make duplicate copies of the battleship target illustrations and the numberd "Special Factors" cards. Then follow the simple attack procedures against each battleship. Damage scores will vary depending where the torpedo hit occurs plus a random number variation. Hence, player can expect a different outcome each time they play the game. The game can be plyed solo to in small groups.

Play as the IJN torpedo bomber force armed with the secret shallow water Type 91 Mod. 2 "Thunderfish" torpedo as they attack American battleships in Pearl Harbor. The attack that ended the battleship era. Game variables include, increasing anti-aircraft resistance, aborted & recycled attack attempts, torpedo stuck in mud, and a variable math expression to calculate damage/flooding calculations. Final game score can be matched against the historical recorded or tallied in other ways (percent damage and/or number of hits).

Games will be mailed in a large envelope.
Printed Game Parts Include:
•Rules of Play

•Illustrated "Graphic" Activity Diagram

•Pearl Harbor Map (letter size paper)

•Battleship Torpedo Target Illustrations (Gray scale prints on legal size 20# paper format) USS Nevada, USS Arizona, USS West Virginia, USS Oklahoma, and USS California

•Special Impact Overlay Transparency

•Score Sheets

•Special Affects/Randomizing Number (print & cut) Game Cards

[Game Parts, Target Illustrations, and Score Sheets are Copyrighted but can be reproduced for non-commercial use by the individual purchaser for years of play in your home or in your school classroom]

147061.name: My Little Pony Online Card Game
147061.description:
User Summary

My Little Pony Online Card Game is a fan-made card game based upon the My Little Pony: Friendship is magic series. It is designed in the style of a CCG, although players can play with all cards online via a plugin for LackeyCCG. Along with building their decks, players choose a Herd Leader card representing one of the show's main characters. Herd Leaders determine a player's hand size, Herd Morale, and special abilities.

Players lose when their Herd Morale is lowered to 0, or they can no longer draw a card. This is primarily done by playing Pony cards; each player may have up to three Ponies on the field at a time. Players may also play Spell cards, with various effects. Any card may be played face-down as a resource. Spells played as a resource may be flipped face-up and played for free, if the player has enough total resources.

Each turn a player may have his ponies clash with any of his opponents. If the opposing pony's power is lower or equal, it is Staggered, and the defending player takes Piercing Damage equal to the difference in power and Stagger Damage equal to the losing pony's cost. At the start of each player's turn, he may revive one of his Staggered ponies. Any others are KO'ed and discarded from play.

147062.description:
First distributed Origins 2013.

If pushed, roll for random direction.
147062.name: Mage Wars: Sandstorm Promo Card

147063.name: Ascension: Immortal Heroes
147063.description:
Ascension: Immortal Heroes requires the Dice Tower & Golden Geek Award winning Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer

Ascension: Immortal Heroes is the third in-app expansion for the popular deck building iOS game Ascension: Chronicle of the Godlsayer. Conceived and designed by three Magic: The Gathering tournament champions, Ascension: Immortal Heroes introduces new game mechanics, and can be played as either a stand-alone game or played as an expansion for Ascension: Storm of Souls.

Samael is slain, but Kythis has begun gathering the souls of fallen heroes to power his ambitions! You are all that stands before Vigil and a new, terrible master!

Ascension: Immortal Heroes features new trophy monsters and events and introduces Soul Gems. Immortal Heroes can be played as a 2-player game or combined with Ascension: Storm of Souls. Purchase Immortal Heroes through Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer.

HIGHLIGHTS
New Event Mechanic
New Faction cards
New Trophy Monsters
Mix Immortal Heroes with other Ascension sets
101 New Center Deck Cards
New Fanatic card!
New Art

FEATURES
Universal Game Application
Expansion Content Available
Game Center Achievements
Invite Game Center Friends
Offline Play
Included AI opponents
Pass-and-play Multiplayer
Real-time and asynchronous Online Games
Online Game Clock Timers
Rematch Button
Next Game Button
Online Help Menu
Player Profile
Selectable Avatar
Selectable Background Theme

Source: The Publisher Website.

147064.name: Nightfall: Martial Law
147064.description:
Nightfall is required to purchase and play Nightfall: Martial Law

Nightfall: Martial Law introduces many new characters, actions and new color combinations for creating chains and achieving kickers. Martial Law will also introduce the new “Feed” mechanic which will allow players to get even more uses out of their orders. The game also brings to the table a new “Wound” effect that is sure to surprise opponents!
Unlocking Promo Cards in Martial Law

Three Promo Cards are included in Martial Law as un-lockable extras! After you earn them, you can add them into your games!
Earning Achievements unlocks the promo cards and they will be visible in the Card Gallery. On the Create Game screen, touch the “Card Sets” button under your avatar to select which card set you'd like to play with, and to add or remove your unlocked promo cards!

Source: The Publisher Website.

147066.name: Kidz Cardz 4 Favorite Card Games
147066.description: Kidz Cardz treatment of Go Fish, Old Maid, War, and Crazy Eights. The 4 decks come individually boxed in cardboard and in a big tin.

147067.name: The Whisky Game
147067.description:
On turn, each player rolls the die and answers the question according to the category shown on the die. Score pad is used to keep track of the score. Game ends after a set time limit or after all cards have been used once. The person with most points is the official whisky champion. Most of the questions are multiple choise.

Re-roll
Each player has 2 re-rolls during the game.

Ask a friend
Helping player gets 2 points and the player gets 1 on a correct answer

Question categories:
Production
Geography
Brands
Occasion & Taste
Trivia
Other

Game includes
71 Quiz cards
Rules
Custom dice
Score pad
Pencil

Www.Nicogame.com

147068.name: Tennis Cards
147068.description: Tennis Cards emulates a game of tennis, with players taking it in turns to select shots from their hand in an attempt to win the point. Each player has only a limited number of cards per game and so must be careful to balance staying in a rally with card conservation.

147069.name: Hi-Skill Poker (Hold 'Em)
147069.description:
User Summary

A poker variant that removes luck from the game, meaning no more bad beats.

147071.name: PEARL HARBOR ATTACK 800KG AP BOMBER STRIKE
147071.description:
Want more realism, direct action play, and observable battle results without losing the lively historic qualities? Tired of small gaming counters, sluggish play processes, or the mindless arcade play of many computer war games? Historians and gamers will find the game pace, play method, and varied outcomes to be fascinating. Parents, teachers, and students will recognize the great advantage of learning while playing.
In this game, you make duplicate copies of the battleship target illustrations and the numbered "Special Factors" cards. Then follow the simple attack procedures against each battleship. Damage scores will vary depending where bomb hits occur plus a random number variation. Hence, player can expect a different outcome each time they play the game. The game can be plyed solo to in small groups.

This game is part of a larger Pearl Harbor Re-enactment Guide. This part of the game based upon the high level bomber attack on Battleship Row, Pearl Harbor. Forty-eight high Level bombers, in ten arrow formations, carrying and dropped the secret "Dragon Tooth" 800kg armor piercing bomb against the inboard battleship on Battleship Row, Pearl Harbor. Fouled by smoke and sun glare, they managed to make a dismal six hits on American battleships. Although, only six big bombs hit American battleships, one No.80 bomb struck and penetrated the USS Arizona's forward powder magazine causing a violent explosion. The game can be adapted easily for solo or team play. Can you do better?

Play Commander Mitsuo Fuchida's attack on American battleships in Pearl Harbor. The attack that ended the battleship era. Game "Special Factors" features include, anti-aircraft resistance, Shoot Downs, Damage Aircraft, Aborted Runs, Smoke differential, Powder Magazine Hit, Near Miss Damage, and a variable Math Expression Calculating Bomb Hit Damage. Final game score can be matched against the historical recorded or tallied in other ways (percent damage and/or number of hits).

Game will be shipped in large envelope.

Printed Game Parts Include:

>Activity Rules

>Illustrated "Graphic" Activity Diagram/Guide
Pearl Harbor Map (Gray scale coloring on letter size paper)
Battleship Target Illustrations (Gray scale prints on legal size 20# paper format) USS Nevada, USS Arizona, USS West Virginia & USS Tennessee, USS Oklahoma & USS Maryland, USS Pennsylvania, and USS California

>Score Sheets

>Unique Bomb Plot Overlay Transparency

>Randomizing Number (print & cut) cards



Game Parts, Target Illustrations, and Score Sheets are Copyrighted but can be reproduced for non-commercial use by the individual purchaser for years of play in your home or in your school classroom

147072.name: Köpfchen Köpfchen
147072.description:
Contents:
One Board
1 rules sheet
4 letter racks
100 wooden tiles

Word game. Separate the vowels from the consonants. Up to four players draw 3 Vowels and 7 consonants. After everyone has their starting 10 tiles, the remaining tiles are mixed together and left face-down as a draw pile. Words are formed vertically or horizontally but two words going in the same direction cannot be formed if it does not leave a space between the letters of both words. The box illustrates this rather well. If you cannot make a legal play, you draw one tile. If you can now play a word, you do so. If not, draw another tile, and so on. If you cannot make a play after drawing three tiles, your turn ends. The winner is the first player to get rid of all his tiles.

In addition, on the board there are some coloured squares. Should your word cross such a square, you must do the following:

Yellow field: Randomly pick a tile from the right neighbour.
Red box: Give the left neighbour a random tile.
Blue field: Take three tiles from the existing stock.
Green field: You must swap one of your tiles with another player. Both players choose a tile for the swap and the tiles are swapped face-down.

147073.name: Thick as Thieves
147073.description:
'Thick as Thieves' is a cooperative board game based on the idea that all players are working together to steal an item from a well guarded museum. You’ll have to work together to infiltrate the system, sneak past guards, and get past the alarms and locked doors. Be careful though, there isn't always honor amongst thieves. At any time, if the opportunity presents itself, a player may choose to betray everyone and steal a secondary item they've been eye-balling since before the heist even started!

Each player is a thief with different abilities moving silently (hopefully) around the museum at night dodging roaming guards and security cameras.
