Find, unlock, and equip your characters with a variety of weapons with different stats and effects.

147267.name: Toypocalypse: The Toys Will Rise
147267.description:
User Description

This is a handcrafted volume which includes both Toypocalypse and Toypocalypse Falls. Each of them was a unique creation and so the photos may all be different.

147268.name: Girls Elsewhere
147268.description:
Publisher Blurb

Girls Elsewhere is an anthology of settings for the storytelling game, Heroine. Seven game designers contributed to this anthology in order to enable you to tell a broader variety of stories about a more diverse selection of heroic girls. From a dark urban setting incorporating Filipino mythology to a time-travel setting about a Native American forest, this book will stretch your imagination and diversify your defi nition of a heroic girl. Emily Care Boss, Filamena Young, Fraser Ronald, Josh Jordan, Julia B. Ellingboe, Nora Last, and Tobie Abad contributed settings to this book.

Each setting includes:

• Sample Fiction
• A List of Stories that were Inspiration for the Setting
• New Rules for the Heroine Player
• New Rules for the Narrator
• New Rules for the Companion Players
• Two Non-English Name Packs

147269.name: The Clans: Warriors of Kerensky
147269.description:
From the back of the book:
"For twelve long years, the Clans have savaged Inner Sphere worlds and armies alike. But who are they? What drives them? This comprehensive report finally puts to rest more than a decade's worth of speculation about the decendants of Kerensky. The information in this document may be the Inner Sphere's greatest weapon against their Clan foes.
The Clans: Warriors of Kerensky describes in detail all the elements that forged the Clans into the ultimate warrior society, including their history, government, customs and homeworlds. This book also covers the Clans' current status and holdings, including a map of Clan space. The Clans: Warriors of Kerensky also features the insignias of each of the original twenty Clans."

147270.name: Battletech: Explorer Corps
147270.description:
From the back cover:

A hundred years ago, Primus Adrienne Sims of ComStar suffered nightmare visions of a dire threat to ComStar and the Successor States - hordes of strange monsters from beyond known space, invading the Inner Sphere to destroy it. These visions so troubled the Primus that she created the Explorer Corps, a division of ComStar dedicated to probing the Deep Periphery, to hunt down the threat she had foreseen.

A century later, the Clan invasion made the nightmare come true - and gave the Explorer Corps a vital role in the Inner Sphere's survival. With the backing of the Draconis Combine, the Explorer Corps has expanded its operations and embarked on a massive hunt for the Clan homeworlds. Small mercenary units from all over the Inner Sphere are joining the search, hired by the Explorer Corps for secret missions into the Deep Periphery - missions from which few return...

The Explorer Corps sourcebook describes the Explorer Corps' history and structure, including key personalities, operational procedures, and the Corps' efforts to locate the Clan homeworlds before the Truce of Tukayyid expires. Also included is background material on life aboard a 31st-century spacecraft and descriptions of various colonies and Clan bases in the Deep Periphery and other inhabitants of that little-known region of space. Special game rules for BattleTech, MechWarrior, and BattleSpace are designed to enhance campaigns involving space travel or planetary exploration; new material includes rules for creating new solar systems and planets to explore, as well as new types of vehicles and 'Mechs.

147271.name: 5 Kingdoms
147271.description:
5 Kingdoms is a card/tile laying game where the object of the game is to score the most points by controlling a combination of five territories called realms. Players draw, manage, and place land cards in patterns according to their type. In addition to placing land cards players must also place five kingdom tokens on the land cards in order to create point scoring realms.

There are six different land cards: deserts, forests, hills, lakes, mountains, and swamps. Each land type is placed in a particular pattern and scored in its own fashion. Lakes are the only land cards that cannot be claimed by a kingdom token to score points.

In basic gameplay the kingdom tokens do not have any special value causing only the claimed land cards to be scored at the games end. During advanced play each of the players five kingdom tokens has a special ability that can effect kingdom token and land card placement or scoring. The five advanced kingdoms are cloud, fire, gold, iron, and water.

5 Kindgoms does not require a playing board or score counter and is limited only by the flat surface it is played on.

Contents:

96 tile cards (16 cards of each land type)
25 double sided kingdom tokens

147273.name: La Grande Corsa nello Spazio
147273.description:
Galassia is a space racing game of the 80s in which each player must be able to build a path from Earth to the planets that were randomly assigned at the beginning of the game, through the placement of the space lanes tiles.

Each player also tries to hinder other players in their purpose. They also have strategic cards at their disposal, which can help a player get past space lanes closed by his opponents.

The spacecraft, which can be moved by all the players, move from Earth to the planets with the spinner.

Players get points for arriving at the planets, with players who arrive earliet getting more points. The game ends when everyone has reached their destination; the player with the most points wins.

147274.description:
Peloponnes: Antioche is a civilization tile (number 11) that was given as a free goodie in Plato Worldwide # 3.

It gives you 9 money and 3 population as a start. It's special function is that it protects you against ALL disasters, but as an income you'll lose 1 population.

This tile was later included as part of Peloponnes: Sacrum Expansion.
147274.name: Peloponnes: Antioche

147275.name: Mighty Heroes and the Monster Zone
147275.description:
Mighty Heroes and the Monster Zone (MHMZ) is a game of strategy and chance utilizing cards, dice, and miniatures. Each player controls a faction (Spies, Ninjas, Robots, or Pirates) consisting of a faction deck of 8+ cards, a miniature representing a Hero, and a display tile. They will advance up the game board with their Hero by attacking fellow players, slipping by uncontested, or by battling monsters. As they move up the board they are hindered and helped by random Special FX cards. Each faction has a unique special ability to aid in their advance. Heroes will also level up as they make progress. The first Hero to make it into the wormhole at the top of the board wins.

Basic Premise: An evil mad scientist has merged our universe with that of the Monster Zone. As is becomes more and more corrupted a wormhole to an alternate dimension opens and all the Heroes desperately attempt to make it through to safety before it closes.

147276.name: Heroes' Tale: The Corrupted Forest
147276.description:
Heroes' Tale: The Corrupted Forest is a fusion of Tabletop RPG and card games. It uses a 20-sided dice system along with playing cards. The game can have has many players as the Game Master wants. One player plays as the Game Master, which plans and controls the world the Heroes live in. The rest play as Heroes’ and try to survive in the world the Game Master creates.

﻿The Heroes can completely customize their own characters through diverse vendor decks, which they use to purchase gear and abilities from. The Game Master may also place down a vendor deck for the Heroes to buy from.​

The Game Master makes his own campaign deck filled with Environment Cards, Creature Cards, and Ally Cards. He uses this deck to create a world for the Heroes to live and fight in. The more cards you have as a game master the better off you are at making any kind of scenario and encounter you would like.

147277.name: Borg
147277.description:
User Summary

In this Berzerk-like clone, Escape from an electrified maze while the Dragon and his minions hunt you down.

147278.name: Borrowed Time
147278.description:
User Summary

A Hard-Boiled detective has to rescue his kidnapped ex-wife in this 1930s adventure.

147279.name: The Bouncing Kamungas!
147279.description:
User Summary

Impale the bouncing Kamungas on the end of your spear. There is a thunderstorm brewing so don't get hit by lightning and watch out for snakes.

147280.name: Sinclair ZX81
147280.description:
User summary:

This is the basic version of the ZX81. It was available in both pre-assembled and kit forms.

147281.name: Timex Sinclair 1000
147281.description:
User Summary:

This was a version of the ZX81 sold by Timex Sinclair. In the USA it was advertised as "The first computer under $100". It differs from the ZX81 primarily in that it has 2Kb of RAM as standard, double that of the original ZX81. US versions also have an NTSC TV output (versions sold in Portugal have PAL output, like the ZX81).

147283.name: Timex Sinclair 1500
147283.description:
User Summary:

The Timex Sinclair 1500 was a development of the Timex Sinclair 1000. It remained 100% compatible with the ZX81. The main changes were an integrated 16KB RAM (compared to 2KB in the Timex Sinclair 1000 and 1KB in the original ZX81) and a rubber chiclet keyboard similar to that used in the ZX Spectrum. The case was silver rather than the usual black.

147284.name: Sinclair ZX 16K RAM
147284.description:
User Summary:

The 16KB RAM pack extended the memory of the ZX80 and ZX81 computers from their in-built 1KB RAM.

A memory expansion was required for many commercially released ZX81 games and RAM expansions were available from many third parties and in various sizes. However the Sinclair 16KB expansion was so common that game inlays often state "ZX81 16KB" or similar, even if the game actually only needs a smaller amount of memory.

147285.description:
The Red Queen is a card game pitting a team of 2 to 5 players against the infamous Queen of Hearts, a character as unpredictable as Lewis Caroll described in Alice's Adventures in Wonderland. Using deduction to work out how best to advance their plans, the team must assemble an army of soldiers to challenge the Red Queen.

In The Red Queen, the player cards are facing outwards in such a manner that all players except the one holding them will know what they are. Each round players will be able to give clues to one another to lift part of the mystery surrounding the pool of cards they collectively possess, build their army, or use special roles actions to help them in this endeavour.

... meanwhile the evil Red Queen will continually interfere with the team using a set of treacherous actions in the hope to make them lose 'heart', literraly, the currency representing the team's morale in the game. Her own army will also grow throughout the game, putting the team under pressure to raise their own as efficiently as possible.

The game features a strong thematic element and role cards based on characters directly inspired by Lewis Caroll's work. Alice herself takes on a key role too, unsurprisingly, but as an outsider will be of equal support to both sides and it is up to the players to make the most of her abilities.
147285.name: The Red Queen

147286.name: Adventure Number Ten
147286.description:
from the book

You will die.

You will be afraid and you will be in pain.

Everything you do in life is but an effort to distract yourself from this inescapable truth.

There is only one way to foil Fate's cruel plan for you.

Choose the method yourself.

Make it happen.

Now.

147287.name: Panzer Bandit
147287.description:
User Summary

A beat em up similar to Guardian Heroes. You have a light and strong attack, can duck and jump, are able to jump between the foreground and background, different combinations of buttons will cause you to preform special attacks, dash, and double jump. The game contains 12 playable character, eight that need to be unlocked, and eight stages.

147288.name: Fühlzwerge
147288.description:
In Fühlzwerge, players need to put fingers on their eyes in order to find the right items fast.

To set up the game, place all twenty cardboard tokens into the bag; these tokens are shaped to resemble the items depicted on them: an elephant, a ship, a wheel, a tree, and so on. Each player receives an equal number of cards from the deck, with each card showing one of these twenty items. The youngest player takes the dwarf die.

When the game starts, everyone but the youngest player shoves one hand into the bag at the same time and tries to grab items depicted on the cards in front of them. If a player draws a token matching such a card, great! Place the item on that card. If he instead draws a token matching a card in front of another player, well, he just helped that player get one step closer to victory as he must place the token of the card anyway. The player with the die rolls it repeatedly, possibly needing to jump up then sit back down, possibly needing to switch hands. As soon as she rolls her second dwarf, she passes the die to the closest player clockwise, who must then start rolling while she tries to fish tokens from the bag.

As soon as someone has tokens on all of her cards, she wins the game! (Players can also play without the die, with everyone fishing for tokens at the same time.)

147289.name: Super Controller
147289.description:
User Summary

This is just a plastic sheath that you clip over the regular NES controller. All the buttons are accessible but the d-pad is covered & a knob inserted over the part covering the d-pad to turn it into a joystick of sorts.

147291.name: Cosmology of Kyoto
147291.description:
User Summary

A first person adventure game set in 10th century Japan featuring mostly hand drawn graphics. The game is, in part, historical showing some events that actually happened along with people who were there but the game also mixes in Japanese myths and legends with spirits and demons as well as elements of philosophy and religion. You are able to bring up a guide that will explain historic events as you witness them. The game features some conversations where you must type a response and some basic puzzles but most of it is just exploring.

When the game starts you name yourself and choose how you will look but during the game you will likely die many times, will experience one type of hell, and then be reborn as another person or thing.

Speech is in Japanese with English subtitles.

While writing about whether or not he thinks video games can be viewed as art Roger Ebert mentioned that he "enormously enjoyed" Cosmology of Kyoto.

147292.name: Final Lap Twin
147292.description:
Final Lap Twin is a hybrid racing/role-playing game released for the TurboGrafx 16 system in 1989, as a spin-off to the 1987 arcade game Final Lap. The protagonist is on a quest to live up to the reputation of his racing-champion dad. He travels over the map, meeting small-time racers, and must race his car to earn money that he spends on upgrading his car, eventually facing the local racing champion. After beating the rest of the local racing champions in the various cities, the protagonist must go through a maze to find the final upgrades of the different parts of his car, and then face the world racing champion.

Source: Wikipedia, "Final Lap Twin", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

147293.description:
The Red Menace are masters of disguise and manipulation! Tentacled monsters that hide in the shadows and mislead with illusions and hallucinations, the Red Menace can be anywhere or anyone. With panic and paranoia amongst the already frightened humans, they now swell the ranks of fanatical doomsday cults in an attempt to flush out this new hidden threat! Because everyone knows, mobs with pitchforks and torches always get the job done.

This new expansion was initially only available at conventions where Flying Frog has a presence (it is now available through their web shop). It includes new Events, Space Stuff, and Resistance as well as the new alien - The Red Menace.
147293.name: Conquest of Planet Earth: 'The Red Menace' Supplement

71882.name: Conquest of Planet Earth: The Space Alien Game

147294.name: The Fate Freeport Companion
147294.description:
From Introduction:

The Fate Freeport Companion is your mechanics supplement for using the Pirate's Guide to Freeport with the Fate Core System. So to maximize this sourcebook's utility, you'll probably want to have a few other books. For setting information, the Pirate's Guide to Freeport is ideal since it not only updates the Freeport setting, but it provides extensive detail about the city, people, environs, and much more. If you already have the original Freeport: The City of Adventure (2003) and other Freeport sourcebooks, those can help too, but be aware that some of the characters and
information in this book reference events that have occurred after the Succession Crisis, which hasn't yet been concluded in the older sourcebooks.

For rules, this Companion works with Fate Core, so you'll need a set of those rules. Other Fate rulebooks, such as the Fate System Toolkit, are useful but not necessary for play.

from the Evil Hat blurb
Welcome to the Fate Freeport Companion! For over a decade, Freeport has stood as one of fantasy gaming’s most distinctive cities. Home to pirates, foul cults, terrifying monsters, vicious gangs, crime lords, and a whole host of corrupt politicians, Freeport is a dynamic setting, offering a unique blend of high adventure and cosmic horror. Inside these packed covers, you’ll find:


Rules design by noted Fate Core authorities Brian Engard and Clark Valentine.
A new skill system for Fate Core that utilizes six base skills: Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma.
A brand-new magic system that melds classic fantasy RPG flavor with Fate Core rules.
An all-new insanity and madness system to evoke the popular Lovecraftian overtones of the City of Adventure.
Rules for using weapons, armor, magic items, and even firearms!
Fate Core stats for Freeport monsters, including the freakish blemmyae and the dreaded burnlings.
Details on the core races and how they fit in the city, as well as rules for implementing player character race in Fate.
Statistics for over 75 heroic allies and and terrible villains described in The Pirate’s Guide to Freeport.
Fury in Freeport: A new adventure to help you launch a brand-new Freeport campaign!


The Fate Freeport Companion is your rules guide to exploring Green Ronin Publishing’s Freeport, whether as a daring hero looking for adventure, or as a Gamemaster seeking new worlds to explore, this sourcebook is an indispensable accessory for fans of both Freeport and the Fate Core System!

147295.name: King of Casino
147295.description:
From inside game manual

Welcome, King of Casino!

Get ready for the most realistic video casino gamed ever. King of Casino features brilliant graphics, realistic sounds and true-to-life action and odds.

You take off on a whirlwind adventure with action that rivals "Vegas," Reno and Monaco! Your adventure begins when you check into your hotel. You stock up on information, listen to some music and then you're on your way to becoming "King of Casino." As you stroll out onto the street, you can choose one of 15 different casinos - some big, some small. Each Casino has it's own characteristics and specializes in 2 or more of 5 different games - poker, blackjack, slot machines, Keno or roulette. Roam around inside. Watch what the other players are doing. Check out the action. Choose your game and prepare yourself, because in a couple of moments, you're the "odds-on" favorite in this fascinating journey of luck and skill.

147296.name: TV Sports Hockey
147296.description:
Inside game manual

Get ready for the total action, total control, totally real competition of TV Sports Hockey! You're right on the ice with intense close-ups of faceoffs, fights, and heart-stopping breakaways. Blast slap shots. Drill deadly wrist shots. Even fake shots to deke the defense. Make crushing body checks. Then drop your gloves and duke it out! Run power plays and kill penalties. Change lines and bring in fresh goalies. The stadium organ is pumping and so are you as you skate out for the network telecast of TV Sports Hockey!

147298.name: Odysseo
147298.description:
Odysseo is a chance and strategy game. The goal is to move your checkers from a starting point to one of the available exits (the opponents' starting points).

During your turn, rolls the dice, then moves one of your checker by the corresponding number of cases. Whenever possible introduce a new checker on the board.
Checkers movement is limited by simple rules: 1) moving back and forth during the same turn is also prohibited; 2) moving through other checkers is not permitted; 3) finishing the movement on an opponent's checkers removes it from the game; 4) finishing the movement on a blue case removes your checker from the game.
Also, having one of your checkers being removed while standing on one of the white cases surrounding your starting point allows you to recover the removed checker.

The game ends when there is only one player with checkers left on the board and scoring is done as such: 1) saved checkers: 2pts each; 2) checkers on the board: 1 pt each; 3) removed checkers: 0 pt each.

The length of the game can be shortened by starting with fewer checkers.

boardgamehonor.24519: 2013 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee

147299.description:
War has erupted across the Imperium! Four spacefaring races struggle for supremacy, launching fleets of starships across the galaxy to battle for control of the most prosperous systems. Only one race will successfully Expand, Explore, Exploit and Exterminate their way to victory!

Pocket Imperium is a 4X microgame. Players will need to use the opportunities to expand, explore, exploit and exterminate to their best advantage. The timing of when to build fleets, when to explore the stars, and when to invade systems controlled by opponents will be crucial in their quest to rule the Imperium.

What's more, in a crowded galaxy, players must choose wisely when to make alliances to bring down powerful enemies — and when to break those pacts to critically weaken their former allies!
147299.name: Pocket Imperium

147302.name: Story Smash-Up
147302.description:
From the box:

"Story Smash-Up is the laugh-out-loud game where movie worlds collide. You create sentences using word cards that feature your favorite scenes. The more you mix 'em, the funnier the sentence!

"Create sentences by playing cards ...
Noun (an alien) + Verb (kissed the prince) + Fragment (on a turtle shell) + Fill in the Blank (and made Mom jealous) = 4 points.
Score 1 point for each card played! At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins!

"Contents: 112 Cards, 10 Tokens, Instructions. "

This game uses story elements from 4 Disney & Pixar films: Cars, Finding Nemo, Toy Story, and Snow White. The basic idea could be used with many other stories of course.

147303.description:
Carcassonne: South Seas keeps the familiar tile-laying gameplay of the original Carcassonne, with players adding a tile to the playing area each round and optionally placing a token on the tile to claim ownership of...something. Instead of the familiar cities, roads and farms, however, players in Carcassonne: South Seas use their meeples to gather bananas, shellfish and fish, then ship those goods to traders in exchange for points.

Carcassonne: South Seas is the first game of a new series titled "Carcassonne Around the World".
147303.name: Carcassonne: South Seas

147304.name: Commando Pinkelen
147304.description:
Reaction game for large groups.

All players, except the dealer, are tapping on the table with their fingers. If the dealer calls a command, which can be a color or symbol, all players should lay their hand on the right card as soon as possible. But beware, a command is not valid if the leader does not say "command". If you make a mistake or are too late, you get a penalty point. Who will be the last man standing?

The simple rules ensure that everyone can participate directly.

Commando Pinkelen is based on a public domain game with the same name.

147305.description:
All those carrots look so tempting that you might just snatch them – but what if the wolves have been expecting exactly that, a greedy rabbit just like you? You never know...

In Om Nom Nom, during the game you will roll dice, which will represent various kinds of prey. By clever play of your hunter cards, you will try to eat the prey and thus gain victory points. At the end of the game the winner will be the player with the most points.

The game consists of 3 rounds. Each round is divided into 4 phases – roll, play, score and cleanup. During the "Roll" phase one of the players rolls all the dice. After rolling the dice are arranged on the game boards. During the "Play" phase all players will play all 6 of their predator cards one by one. When everyone has selected their first card, they are revealed simultaneously. This is where the action happens. Did You manage to guess what everyone else will play? Were You the only one brave enough to sneak Your mouse after the cheese? Or did You like everyone else play the wolf, because no rabbit surely could resist that amount of carrots. During this phase, players resolve all their played cards by capturing dice and cards of other players. During the "Score" phase players score points for captured cards and dice. And during the "Cleanup", when all 6 cards have been played, players gather all their cards back in hand and a new round can begin. At the end of the third round, player with the most points is the winner.
147305.name: Om Nom Nom

147312.name: Reign of Evil
147312.description:
It is the year 2025 and the entire world has fallen under the reign of a group of super villains known only as "The Collective". People are oppressed and the world has fallen deep into darkness with little hope of even a glimpse of light. In this dark world, a group of superheroes has risen to combat the villains and retake the world from their grasp.

Each mission is deadly, as both villains and superheroes must enter combat, defend themselves, and collect the previous element "levinium" or face destruction. Levinium is the heroes's hope of taking down the villains.

Reign of Evil is a print-and-play game in the genre of superheroes and supervillians. The game uses a card mechanic, and no dice, in order to perform combat. It plays quickly with minimal down time for players. Players move figures around the board to collect levinium until all wound markers are exhausted, until the deck runs out, or all levinium pieces are gone. Alternatively, players can play timed games. On their turns, players draw a hand of cards that contain a mix of Move and Action cards. Using these cards, players move around the board and take various actions, such as combat or collecting levinium.

147313.name: Epic Chess
147313.description:
A fantasy expansion for chess, adding dice, cards, tokens, and treasure chests.

Players receive Mana tokens that may be traded to activate special abilities, cast spells, or upgrade units.

Treasure chests, scattered across the field, contain weapons, armor, potions, and accessories to boost individual pieces.

Each piece is assigned a die value (D4, D6, D8, etc.) for combat, as well as three special abilities. Pawns dig up treasure. Bishops cast healing and other protective spells. Queens send lightning bolts across the playing field. Kings inspire nearby units, and so forth.

Winning conditions are similar to traditional Chess, except that the king must be defeated in combat. Check and Check Mate simply offer bonuses to defeating the King.

Epic Chess preserves the sound strategic elements of traditional Chess, while adding many new elements for Chess players of any level to enjoy!

147314.description: Lost Legends: Demon Hunter, a mini-expansion for Lost Legends, adds a new hero to the base game that a player can choose to be. The Demon Hunter's special ability allows him to add 1 damage of Chaos to his attack each time that he fights a humanoid.
147314.name: Lost Legends: Demon Hunter (Queenie 1)

147315.description:
Lost Legends: Forest of the Damned, a mini-expansion for Lost Legends, consists of a new Level 1 monster deck that replaces the "Ruins" monster deck from the base game. It contains six animals, five humanoids, five undead and four dragons.

The rules are explained in German and English, but the cards contain only English text.
147315.name: Lost Legends: Forest of the Damned (Queenie 2)

147317.name: Jenga: Space Invaders Collector's Edition
147317.description: A Space Invaders-themed Jenga set with a new type of game play. As you remove blocks you're also trying to move your Invader down the tower, so you can kill the puny humans.

147318.description:
Caesar campaign's in Britannia: 55 & 54BC

THE GAME PLAY

To win, Caesar has to score points. He gains points when:
- He explores unknown regions
- He submits British tribes
- He returns in Gaul with his legions British hostages and booty

To win the Celtic has to prevent Caesar from marking points.

The first expedition lasts one month and Caesar has only two legions. It's very difficult for him to disembark.
The second expedition lasts two months. Caesar has 5 legions and the famous Gallic cavalry.

Actions in the game
A player takes an action with a chief, and then the other player takes an action too.
- Move
- Recruit (only for the Tribes, random units)
- Ravage (only for the Romans)
- Play a Stratagem (special real historical action)
- Reinforcement
- submit a tribe (for the roman player)
- Caesar special actions

Bounty
- it can boost recruitment and reinforcement
- you gain it with battle victory and ravage

Battle
- 4 tactical choices (units in first line can make critical hit but are the first to die)
- the best general has rerolls
- fire phase
- 2 melee phases

Specials
- Chariot actions: flee, dismount, special attack...
- bretons counters are hidden (not the number but the unity)

Available with French rules, but English rules can be downloaded from Vae Victis website.
147318.name: Caesar Imperator: Britannia

147321.name: Marble Madness / Klax

videogameversion.218278: North American Game Boy Advance edition

147321.description:
Marble Madness is an arcade video game designed by Mark Cerny, and published by Atari Games in 1984. It is a platform game in which the player must guide an onscreen marble through six courses, populated with obstacles and enemies, within a time limit. The player controls the marble by using a trackball.

Klax is a 1989 computer puzzle game designed by Dave Akers and Mark Stephen Pierce. The object is to line up colored blocks into rows of similar colors to make them disappear, similar to Columns.

Source: Wikipedia, "Marble Madness", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Source: Wikipedia, "Klax (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

147323.name: PaTaank
147323.description:
From back of game box

PaTaank (puh-TONK) is the first 3-D pinball experience that puts YOU in the game! PaTaank delivers the exhilaration of an amusement park ride with the challenge of an action from packed pinball game. You get all the non-stop action from a first-person "point-of-view" - You ARE the pinball!

- Intense 3-D pinball action features bumpers, ramps, drains, drop targets and more!

- Blast through a world of intense graphics, video action walls and hard-driving stereo music and sound effects!

- Choose from 3 unique pinball playing levels with giant "backplate bossed," interconnected by hair=raising tunnels and hidden chutes. Or play the Meta Game - a wild ride through all 3 game levels.

- Test your skills - Beginning through advanced levels

- Up to 4 players can compete for high scores!

147325.name: Sports Jam
147325.description:
From the back of the box

All your favorite sports in 1 huge game!

Football, Baseball, Basketball, Hockey, Tennis, Soccer,Golf, and Cycling! You must master skills from each of these sports to take on competitors in your quest to earn the title of King of Sports! Each game features full 3D characters and background graphics detailing your accomplishments or defeats. Play well and you'll learn what it feels like to be a champion in the greatest sports the world has to offer!

147326.name: Rolling Thunder 3
147326.description:
Rolling Thunder 3 is a 1993 run and gun video game published by Namco released for the Sega Genesis. It a sequel to Rolling Thunder 2. The game was made specifically for home consoles, which allowed the developers to implement more extensive gameplay features that otherwise would not had been possible in a regular arcade release. Unlike its predecessors, Rolling Thunder 3 was released only in North America.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rolling Thunder 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

147327.name: Numenera XP Deck
147327.description:
User Summary

The deck contains 30 cards, with each representing 1 or 4 XP. The cards can be given whenever a player earns XP or needs to award XP to another player.

147328.name: Numenera Cypher Deck
147328.description:
User Summary

A deck of 120 cards to help the GM and player randomly create cyphers. 20 of the cards will show what type of object the cypher is and 100 of the cards will list two or three powers that the object can have.

147329.name: Cursed Treasure 2
147329.description:
User Summary

An upgrade heavy tower defense game. Use three towers each placable on corresponding landscape features. Crypts on snow, demon towers on rock and dens on grass. Dens correspond with orc upgrades, crypts with undead and demon towers with demons.

Try to keep pesky humans from stealing your gems.

Unlock upgrades in the skills menu. Reach achievements for bonus experience. Try to get brilliant ratings in each stage during night and day. At night you can only build near your cave and other towers.

147330.name: Mouse Tails
147330.description:
Subtitle: Rodent Playing Game

Publisher's description:

Mouse Tails is a lite story telling RPG designed to help role playing parents introduce their hobby to their young children.

Characters are sentient mice living in our own real present day world. A sentient mouse is a mouse who thinks with human-like intelligence. Well, you think like a human thinks a mouse would think anyway. But beyond that, you are still simply a normal mouse. Not a cartoon or humanoid mouse who wears clothes and drives a car, just a real every day little mouse. You can use and manipulate items around you to your advantage (if you can come up with ways to do so) but, you don’t carry around a bag of tools and you certainly don’t wield a sword.

147331.name: Numenera GM Screen
147331.description:
User Summary

Recommended for use with The World's Greatest Screen from Hammerdog Games.

Four pages of Numenera Artwork, four pages of the same artwork that also show the Numenera logo, and four pages of tables and information for the GM.

147332.name: Folklore
147332.description:
Subtitle: A Rules-Light Roleplaying Game

Publisher's description:

Folklore is a complete rules-light generic roleplaying game designed to be playable after about ten minutes of reading, with enough structure to keep your adventures running smoothly. If you and your friends want to slay dragons and save princesses with little to no prep-time, Folklore just may be the game for you.

This game has been trimmed down to the point that the entire rules set fits into a nice 4 page pamphlet. The pamphlet is merely a double sided 8.5 x 11 piece of paper folded in half.

Folklore’s system uses standard six-sided dice in play, requiring players a certain amount of successes on their dice to overcome conflict. A die is considered to have rolled a success if it produces the numbers 4, 5, or 6. The system has been built around this dice mechanic and since the math never strays away from addition or subtraction, even kids should be able to play with relative ease.

147333.name: Basilisk!
147333.description:
Publisher's description:

The town of Cayhill needs your help... They've been living their lives blindfolded...

Basilisk! is an adventure compatible with Folklore: A Rules-Light Roleplaying Game, but can be used in any game that you prefer!

In the same way that Folklore is a rules-light game, Basilisk! is a light adventure. What that means is that instead of finding intricate point by point plot details, you will find that Basilisk! has no more than what you need to prepare you for a game session. It will be up to you, however, to add your own narrative to the adventure and figure out how the players fit in. More than anything, make sure that they have fun along the way.

147334.name: Numenera: Core Building Set
147334.description:
User Summary

A terrain set for Numenera. Features tiles, doors, machinery, portals, pillars, ramps, and straight, angled, and curved walls. Uses E-Z Lock construction to allow you to easy disassemble and rebuild.

147335.name: Chicken Heroics
147335.description:
Publisher's description:

Experience a new and unique fantasy rpg setting in a world without elves, orcs, and dwarves! Or Humans for that matter.

Hatch a character and enter a world of fowl adventure!

Battle the Cult of Cluckthulu!

Confront a Tyrannosaurus!

You may be a chicken, but you aren't a coward!


All you need to play is this book and a pile of pennies
Simple 3 Stat System (ATK, SPD, DEF)
More than 30 Spells and Abilties
2 Short Sample Adventures
20 Paper Miniatures
Lots and Lots of Puns

147336.name: Rocket Amoeba
147336.description:
Publisher's description:

Jetting in to save the day for everyone who wants to play story games with their friends but is menaced by gigantic books or rules that melt your brain!

Rocket Amoeba is a set of roleplaying game rules you can use for almost any genre or setting.

Simple! Fast! Adaptable!

It keeps things simple, so it’s quick to get going and to play, leaving you to focus on your characters and their exciting stories.

All you need is a group of trusty pals with imagination and itchy raygun fingers, plus pencils and paper, some index cards and a few six-sided dice.

147337.name: Time Warp
147337.description:
User Summary

This was put out by Zellers in Canada with a funky picture & the title "Time Warp" in white text on the end. There is nothing else on the cart. These Zellers carts are very rare.

The game is space shooter.

147338.name: Woodmuir
147338.description:
Publisher's description:

Woodmuir is an isometric map of a lonely woodland village perfect for any fantasy or medieval campaign. This fifteen page pdf includes an 11x17 overview, a 34x22 tiled and gridded players' map, a keyed GM's map, and an optional Woodmuir legend!

147339.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 199 - 2013)
147339.description: User Summary: Brian join's Crutch's Game. B.A. and Patty make for gossip as they have a "romantic" dinner at Pizza-A-Go-Go. Dave get's behind the screen again to run a spy-game.

147340.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 200 - 2013)
147340.description: User Summary: The Special 200th Issue, almost twice as much content, featuring a cover from Larry Elmore.

147341.name: Slaughterama!
147341.description:
In Slaughterama, you are a vigilante hero who sets out to rid the land of evil, while also acting as clerk of your very own medieval store called a Bazaar. Traverse a unique board made up of tiles and fight a variety of demented foes. Once defeated, rob them of their treasures and use them to buy weapons and magic at opponent’s shops. There are also traps to avoid, the risk of becoming a zombie, snipers to watch out for, & magic portals that open up as the game progresses. This is a multi-player game, in fact, the more people playing...the more insane it becomes!

Slaughterama is a new, innovative table top game that is easy to learn yet quite challenging to win. There’s a good balance between luck and strategy, and the gameplay is fun NOT frustrating. With a variety of game mechanics at work, Slaughterama offers an engaging experience that is unlike anything else on the market today.

Amount of Players: 4 players (more by adding future deckpacks)

Object: Kill all 10 of the monsters in your deck before your opponents kill the ones in theirs.

Setting: A “medievalish” alternate universe where anarchy & chaos go for breakfast.

Duration: Customizable. A normal 4 player game on average takes about 90 minutes.

Game Mechanics: Dice rolling, pawn moving, simple RPG fighting system, card playing, buying/selling goods.

147342.name: Burning Opera
147342.description:
designer summary

You’re all members of a drama group in Venice. All of you are rehearsing a play you’re going to perform in the next days in “La Fenice” theater. All of a sudden a fire breaks out; due to the current renovation of the play house, alarm systems are out of service, so you’re not aware of what’s happening. The flames enclose the structure, and for you it’s too late: doors won’t budge anymore, and every fire exit is shut. You try to concretize: “someone will help us” you think. But as time passes, nothing happens but the flames devouring the structure more and more. The stage, the only perfectly intact area, is the place you choose to shelter yourself. Hope starts to fade away, so you decide to do a last, crazy thing: you act. You decide to play what you’d like to do right now, knowing you probably will die.

147343.name: Zero Tolerance
147343.description:
Zero Tolerance is a 1994 video game developed by Technopop and published by Accolade exclusively for the Sega Mega Drive/Genesis video game console. It was one of the only Mega Drive/Genesis first person shooters. Due to the limitations of the hardware, the player's view of the 3D environment was restricted to a fraction of the screen, with the player's HUD, a map of the surrounding area, and the player character's ID card comprising the rest of the screen space. Still, it featured impressive visual effects for its time and especially for the Genesis, a system with hardware that lacked much of the necessary scaling and rotation technologies normally needed to create even the most rudimentary appearance of 3D environments (such as rival Super NES' built-in "Mode 7" technology and "Super FX Chip" add-on). In fact, the smoothness and speed at which Zero Tolerance ran was said to rival many of the lower-end versions of Doom available at the time, most notably the one for the Super NES.

Source: Wikipedia, "Zero Tolerance (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

147345.description:
Rawen's land has been a place of war for hundreds of years. Twelve empires, twelve powerful gods — all longing for the same thing: limitless might.

Everything started with a Cataclysm and the appearance of the New Ones, who ruthlessly squelched the Old Ones — except for those who escaped into other planes of existence, specifically four parts of the world that managed to survive the catastrophe: the Big Continent, also known as Askalar where most of the empires lay; to the North, Iceland, the Isle of the Mages; in the south, Fireland, the home of Demons; and in Oceania, Bale, the Life Tree's territory.

The fight has not ended after the New Ones victory. The balance of forces varies, and it takes only a little to break the fragile balance. Fellowships are made, then breached in moments, but the stakes are much bigger than the power over Rawen. The New Ones fight not just for victory; they are seeking themselves. A secret part of their essence, which they can hardly remember. They were born on another world, which they gave up in exchange for survival. In the depths of their minds, a name pulsates about which neither their new dependents nor The Old Ones might know: Earth. The War of the Gods started in the far past of Rawen, but it affects the future of the whole universe.

In the Rawen Trading Card Game, the Gods of Rawen wield their power through their Warlords. As they expand their territories, the armies of the opposing Gods frequently battle one another. Your goal is to defeat the enemy warlord with the help of fighting units, heroes, and summoned spells. Successful attacks by your army weaken your enemies, and thus weaken their God, too. If the enemy warlord ever has as many wounds as health points, the warlord dies and you win the battle.

In game terms, each player chooses a warlord and a class, then creates a deck of at least 45 cards, with the warlord card, class card and primeval energy cards not counting toward this total. The game is turn-based, and in the main phase of your turn, you may act in any order, placing cards from your hand onto the battlefield, attacking with your units, activating a special power, and so on.
147345.name: Rawen TCG

147346.name: Bug Too!
147346.description:
Bug Too! is the sequel to Bug!, a Sega Saturn game that was also ported to Windows. Bug Too! is a third person platform/adventure game, and has lots of console-style play mechanics. The player can play as Bug and/or his 2 new sidekicks, Maggot Dog and Super Fly. The player goes through several new 3D worlds, all of which are parodies of movies. The player must defeat the themed villains through all of the environments to make Bug's homeland safe once again.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bug Too!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

147347.name: NFL '97
147347.description:
NFL '97 is a follow-up video game to Sega's classic Joe Montana series on the Sega Mega Drive/Genesis. NFL '97 featured some sound effects directly from that series. NFL 97 was released exclusively for the Sega Saturn.

Source: Wikipedia, "NFL '97", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

147348.name: Poker Face Paul's Solitaire
147348.description:
Another in the Poker Face Paul series, this one centering around the game of solitaire. There are four different versions of solitaire to play (Klondike, Monte Carlo, Eleven and Calculation) each with their own look and set of rules. There are in-game instructions that can help out the player during these games in case they get confused as well as hints that will help out the player as the progress. Players can also choose to turn these hints on or off as well as change time limit (ten minutes, eight minutes, seven minutes, six minutes, or disabled).

Source: Wikipedia, "Poker Face Paul's Solitaire", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

147350.name: Enter the Unknown

rpgissuearticle.162255: A cœur de l'inconnu: le manuel des explorateurs

rpg.19360: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire

rpgpodcastepisode.152221: Tales From the Hydian Way: Episode 43 – Exploring a Tale

147350.description:
From the Publisher:

Edge of the Empire: Enter the Unknown

Enter the Unknown, a supplement for the Star Wars: Edge of the Empire Roleplaying Game, features new content for the Explorer career. Explorers will find all-new specializations, talents, and signature abilities, while all players will benefit from new character, vehicle, and equipment options. Enter the Unknown also provides tools for making stronger and more diversified characters. Meanwhile, GMs can find advice on incorporating the themes of exploration, trade, and hunting into their campaigns. It’s time to Enter the Unknown!

An Explorer’s Handbook for the Edge of the Empire RPG


Includes new Explorer specializations such as the Archeologist and Driver



Features new options for backgrounds, Obligations, and Motivations, based on the themes of exploration, hunting, and trade



Introduces new equipment options useful to all players



A powerful tool for GMs to use in crafting campaigns with an exploration theme, or to more deeply involve Explorer characters in the narrative of an adventure

147351.name: Imaginary Friends
147351.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Imaginary Friends is an adventure for the Hero System/ Champions 6th Edition and Savage Worlds in which invisible playmates come to life with deadly consequences. As much a long-term campaign supplement as an adventure, it features a set of strategies and events using the characters and depicting forces at work, rather than a completely linear narrative. You'll meet an entertaining array of sinister and unique characters who will engage role players in tests of combat and the mind unlike anything you've seen before! I know you've probably heard that before once or twice, but I really mean it. Every playtest of this adventure has been fantastic, be it rules light or rules heavy. We hope you'll be pleased and surprised at what you find inside the pages of Imaginary Friends. It's a very different sort of gaming experience.

147352.name: Cuboro Tricky Ways
147352.description: The goal is to build long marble tracks. On your turn you can move and/or rotate (Cuboro) elements. So that your marble track ends on an empty exit. You score points by the length (used Cuboro elements) of your track. The game is based on the cuboro system. There are different versions included. With the easy one you use only one level of the elements (on top). In the more challinging version you use tunnels as well.

147353.name: Legendary Foes
147353.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Book of Beasts: Legendary Foes, the premiere monster book for high level and mythic Pathfinder games, is now available in print. This book is chocked full of monsters of terrifying power, difficult to build NPCs to be feared, demigods that inspire awe and trembling, and traps to keep your players on their toes, all of which at a level of difficulty that few have seen to date.

147354.name: Der geheimnisvolle Spiegel
147354.description:
The young magicians are back in Der geheimnisvolle Spiegel (The Mysterious Mirror), exploring a house and seeing what they can find when they look in the mirror. Even better, they want to get their fellow magicians to guess the shapes of what they draw in the mirror!

To set up, players each take a magician tile and slide it into the bottom of one of the tile ladders; they also shuffle the 46 "magic symbol" tiles, each of which shows a line drawing of a familiar item, e.g., candle, butterfly, arrow, spider's web, etc.

The starting player draws a tile, takes the magic wand, and "draws" the image seen on this tile onto the back of the large "mysterious mirror" with the light of the wand. The other players try to guess the image drawn; the first player to do so gets to draw with the wand next, while the previous drawer places that tile into the bottom of her tile ladder. Players keep taking turns this way until someone pops her magician tile out of the top of the ladder, winning the game.

With two players, Der geheimnisvolle Spiegel is a co-operative game, with players taking turns drawing an image that the other player must guess. If a player draws three times and her fellow magician still can't guess, then the tile is placed into a third tile ladder. If this ladder fills before one of the magician's ladders, then they both lose the game.

147356.description: Gladiatori: The Dog is a new miniature for the Gladiatori board game. This miniature allows Animal variant in the game.
147356.name: Gladiatori: the Dog

147357.description: Gladiatori: The Bear is a new miniature for the Gladiatori board game. This miniature allows Animal variant in the game.
147357.name: Gladiatori: the Bear

147358.name: Major Powers
147358.description:
From publisher blurb:

Major powers of the Darkness are direct personal servants of the dragons. Some are major seraphs who fell (e.g., Reshep), while others are fallen minor seraphs (e.g., Forcas) who’ve grown in power over millennia. Major powers act as the de facto rulers of the Darkness, communicating the will of their bound masters to lesser servants. Some work feverishly to free their masters. Others enjoy their increased power and only serve their masters with lip service and delay.

Creatures of Darkness Vol 3: Major Powers is the third in a series of monsters to be offered for the Rogue Mage game.

147359.name: Twilight Falling
147359.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder adventure for 5 characters of levels 5-7

A plague sweeps through the streets of Crepus, the city of the Twilight Hold, where the souls of the dead go to rest. A mysterious malefactor has erected a barrier between the realm of the living and the dead, preventing the fallen from crossing over. Meanwhile, the Circle, seven high-ranking Companions who rule over the city, can feel their connection with the Twilight Hold weakening. When ferocious corpses begin to rise and torment the people of Crepus, the Circle call upon heroes to aid them. Who is the cause of this scourge which threatens to destroy Crepus and it’s way of life? Will Crepus’ new champions be able to find the source before it is too late?

Also included in “Twilight Falling”:

A new city where the souls of the dead are as much a part of life as the living
The Honored, a new monster comprised of the venerated spirits of the deceased who serve the will of the Circle

147360.name: Cutting Silver Pass
147360.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Compatible Adventure for 4-6 level 7 characters

The remote mining town of Imarlap relies on magic for its silver exports, but its mage is now missing. He planned to open a new route and the silver barons grow desperate to complete his work. The PCs must discover the wizard’s underground cavern and join the town to the new pass. The denizens and other underground hazards make cutting through the roots of the mountain extremely dangerous, but the town needs heroes to finish cutting Silver Pass!

Also included in ‘Cutting Silver Pass’:

Encounters while riding river rapids, both above ground and below.
Engineering projects like silver mining, lock building, and bridging waterfalls to introduce to your fantasy campaign.
A new location set in a remote mountain location. A perfect setting for any frontier town.
Negotiations with neighboring residents including a silver dragon, a werebear druid, the White Water orcs band and a family of stone giants.

147361.name: Necropunk Bestiary
147361.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF requires the Necropunk Campaign Setting and Pathfinder Core Rulebook to use.

Included:

Alien Template
12 new monsters (+ variants)
5 iconic NPC stat blocks at levels 1, 5, 10, 15, and 20
Ghouls and a security agent stat blocks

147362.description:
Improve your games with this victory points chits. They can be used as denomination for currency, damage or victory points but his design in transparent fluorescent metachrylate makes them fit perfectly for any futuristic game.

The tokens are available in 3 different varieties, different in size and design small blue tokens for small denominations: 1,5,10… and also is available a special orange counter for higher numbers or a Star player symbol.
147362.name: Futuristic Victory points

boardgameintegration.198619: DC Comics Dice Masters: Green Arrow and The Flash

147363.description:
Yu-Gi-Oh! Dice Masters is a dice-building game patterned after Quarriors! that features custom dice representing various characters from the 4K Media show.

In the game, each player brings a set of dice to the table; these form his team, from which only he can purchase dice. In addition, each player brings two basic action cards, which are placed in the center of the table; both players can purchase them.

During a turn, a player draws and rolls a number of his dice, purchases additional dice, and fields character dice to attack the other player. A player wins once the opposing player has been reduced to zero life.

Yu-Gi-Oh! Dice Masters is one of several planned Dice Masters games, all of which can be intermixed (or played alone).
147363.name: Yu-Gi-Oh! Dice Masters

147365.description:
The game is a draughts or checkers game for a 3-D board of the type popularized by the TV and film franchise Star Trek. The rules for that game including how the board works can be found at the following link on Chess Variants:

http://www.chessvariants.org/3d.dir/startrek.html

Play begins with black pieces on all dark squares of the lowest fixed board and similarly on the two movable boards which start adjacent to it. To move a movable board, it must be empty at the time but with that proviso one can on a turn either move a movable exactly as in 3-D chess (explained below for clarity) or move a piece. The rules are exactly as in standard draughts (checkers) otherwise.

A big difference is that the movable board which start with white pieces begin BELOW, not above, the upper fixed board and movable boards start away from the player.

How the board works:
3 checkered 4x4 boards with a white square on the near right corner for either player are in fixed positions at levels 2, 4 and 6. The lateral edges are aligned but the three fixed boards are staggered so that the nearer two rows of the middle fixed board (at level 4) exactly overlap the farther two rows of the fixed board nearer to either player. The fixed board on which the black player has pieces starting is at level 2 and thus lower than the middle board. Similarly the fixed board on which white pieces start are at level 6 and thus above the middle fixed board.

4 movable checkered 2x2 boards with a white space in the nearer right corner are also included. Two of these boards start at level 3 with one corner each overlapping either of the two corners of the fixed board at level 2 farther away from the black player so that the other 3 spaces of the movable boards are not over that same fixed board; these two movable boards start filled with black pieces. Similarly 2 movable board start at level 5 filled with white pieces, and these board start with one corner overlapping either of the two corners of the fixed board at level 6 farther away from the white player. The other three squares are not under that same fixed board.

Levels 1 and 7 start empty. A variant of the game makes all the board fixed in their initial positions. When movement of movable board is allowed, an empty movable board can be moved up or down 2 levels (but not above level 7 or below level 1) in which case it switches between above or below the same corner of a given fixed board. Without changing level, the movable board can be moved to a position above or below the other corner along the same edge of a fixed board as it already occupies. So a movable board at level 7 above the back right corner of the fixed board at level 6 can if empty be moved to above the back left or front right corner of the board at level 6, assuming of course no other movable board is already there.

Spaces directly above or below each other will have the same color.

Pieces' moves general conventional draughts moves to 3-D as follows. One looks at the board from above and flattens it. If the piece could move onto a space in this flattened version of the board, it can move onto it so long as a piece does not skip a level. Namely, in a non-capturing move, one cannot move directly from level 4 to level 6 and one can only do so in a capturing move if jumping a piece on a board at level 5.

What playing is like:
It sounds harder than it is but does take some getting used to. The board geometry makes things interesting.
147365.name: 3-D Draughts

147366.name: Sink the Titanic
147366.description:
Sink the Titanic is a 1-2 player board game that pits you, the icebergs, against the evil Titanic. You must stop the Titanic from reaching its destination, but be careful, the captain isn't all there.

When playing a solo game, roll the two dice to determine the Titanic's speed and direction, then move each of your icebergs one space. In a two-player game, the player controlling the Titanic rolls the speed die, then determines which direction to move; the iceberg player then moves each of his icebergs one space.

The icebergs win if one of them moves across the Titanic's bow or if the Titanic runs through an iceberg.

147367.name: Die Maus
147367.description:
User Summary

Based on the famous character from "Die Sendung mit der Maus" (The Program with the Mouse), a highly acclaimed children's series on German television, the player needs to find the lost little duck.

147369.description: A tin box combining two classic family games. Scrabble includes a split quad-fold full size board, 100 full size wooden tiles, 4 wooden tile racks, instructions & plastic tile bag. Yahtzee contains a small dice cup, 5 slightly smaller than standard 6 sided dice, 8 plastic chips, Yahtzee scoring pad and instructions.
147369.name: Scrabble and Yahtzee

147370.description:
Robot Turtles is a board game for kids ages 3-8. Kids won't know it, but while they're playing, they're learning the fundamentals of programming.

Every player ("Turtle Master") takes a turtle and a matching deck of cards. Stack the cards face up on the table in piles, then build a maze for each player out of walls and a jewel. The youngest turtle master goes first, placing his first card down, then moving (or having his parent move) the turtle accordingly. As players progress, they build their program on the table; if they make a mistake, they can shout "Undo!" and debug it.

Before too long, kids figure out the secret of Robot Turtles: It lets the kids control the grown-ups! The little programmers put instruction cards down, driving the turtles through the maze, but the grown-up is the computer, executing commands on the board. At its heart, Robot Turtles is a game about bossing around adults, just like programming is about bossing around computers.
147370.name: Robot Turtles

147371.name: Wedding Planners Cortex Plus
147371.description:
Publisher blurb:

During the War, some folks chose a side and others pitted the Alliance and the Independents against each other for fun and profit. Well, mostly profit. Enter Templeton Steele, a powerful weapons designer whose bride-to-be is none other than the lovely Liliana Fairchild. Now, on account of these two lovebirds getting hitched, you and your crew are hired to transport Lilly to a fancy ship called the Rim’s Dream. Sounds easy enough, right? Unite the happy couple and they'll get paid? Only thing is, this Princess ain't exactly happy about the wedding. The more you find out, the worse this job gets – and the less chance you have of getting paid.

Wedding Planners is presented by Margaret Weis with art by Kurt Komoda. This Episode is part of the Echoes of War role-playing adventure series, which is centered on a common theme: the Unification War. Echoes of War adventures are compatible with the Firefly Role-Playing Game and all subsequent releases.

This version of Wedding Planners employs the Cortex Plus game system and requires the Serenity Crew, which is sold separately. The Firefly Role-Playing Game is based on the hit television series by Fox.

This release was first featured in Gaming in the 'Verse: Gen Con 2013 Exclusive. This title is the stand-alone version.

147372.name: Irish Freedom
147372.description:
Game Summary:
Irish Freedom is a solitaire wargame covering the Irish war of independence, and then the Irish civil war. The player controls the Irish forces fighting the British, then, after the treaty with Britain, plays the role of Michael Collins' Free State forces against the anti-treaty Republicans.

Components:

Map
Rules
British counters (Army, RIC, Black & Tans, UVF)
Irish Free State counters (Mob, Guerillas, Regulars, A/Car, Artillery)
Irish Republican counters (Mob, Guerillas, Flying column)
D6 is required




Playing time = 30-60 minutes.

Game play:
As the Irish player, you must first force the British to end the war in a treaty. This is done by denying areas of the country to them and eliminating British units. After this is completed, the Irish forces split along the line of the civil war. As the Free State (pro-treaty) player you will likely be initially outnumbered by the Republicans (anti-treaty), but with superior organisation and tactics, you can force their surrender.

Historical background and the game: There are very few games on either the Irish war of independence, or the subsequent civil war. The war of independence can be indirectly blamed on the Germans. In 1912, after years (centuries, some would say) of resistance, the British parliament passed the Irish Home Rule bill. The bill then began to grind its way through parliament to become law. This was widely approved in Ireland, apart from the North-east, where the largely Protestant population feared for their future in what would be a largely Catholic state. They started to arm themselves as the Ulster Volunteer Force (UVF), and so did their Irish nationalist adversaries. Civil war looked likely, but was happily averted by the sudden arrival of several million heavily armed Germans in Belgium and France. Both the UVF and the Nationalists then happily joined the British army to fight the common foe. Meanwhile, the home rule bill was suspended for the war's duration, but sure it would all be over by Christmas... wouldn't it?

It wasn't, and by 1916 some more radical Nationalists (called Republicans) got fed up and in Easter staged a farcical uprising, limited to those units that didn't get the message that it had been called off. It was crushed, but the hanging of the leaders, and the increasing harshness of British measures as the war progressed caused a sea-change in public opinion. In the 1918 general election, almost all of Ireland (not the North-east) voted in the Sinn Fein party, which refused to sit in the British parliament and, in 1919 declared Irish independence. Desultory fighting started between the new Irish Republican Army (IRA) and British forces. This is the point at which the game starts, with IRA units of varying capability in most areas of Ireland, and British garrisons (mostly Royal Irish Constabulary) throughout. In 1920 the home rule bill (remember it) passed, but by now with a special amendment allowing two parliaments - one for the North-east (now called Northern Ireland) and one for the rest of Ireland. Sinn Fein ignored it, as they already considered themselves independent, while Northern Ireland voted itself into existence. The game shows this effect with Northern Ireland having extra military units of the UVF.

As the war progressed, the IRA were most successful in the Southern parts of Ireland, and the British forces were gradually excluded from the countryside and limited to towns. The game simulates this by giving different units different strength depending on the terrain - IRA guerillas and Flying columns are best in the countryside, the British better in the urban areas.

With neither side able to win, and the British half expecting the home rule bill to have solved things in the first place, a peace treaty was signed. The treaty gave Southern Ireland (now called the Free State) Dominion status (like in Australia or Canada), with the King still as head of state, and cemented the separation of Northern Ireland. Naturally, this disgusted the more radical elements of Sinn Fein (led by Eamon De Valera), and military units who considered that they had won and so should have full independence. An election in 1922 was won handily by the pro-treaty Sinn Fein, but this did not solve things and fighting started as the pro-treaty forces, under Michael Collins, started to assert themselves over the anti-treaty forces. At this point, the players forces are split - largely along historical lines, with the South containing more anti-treaty forces, and the East more pro-treaty forces. As the player, you control the Free State forces against the anti-treaty republicans. This also means that you need to be careful how you fight the British since you will be raising troops that may not be loyal to the Free State!

Initially outnumbered, the Free State forces rapidly mobilised and quite quickly crushed the Republicans. They used innovative tactics, notably landing troops by ship at key points behind enemy lines, and were able to win battles because they generally had artillery and armour (armoured cars) while the republicans didn't. In the game you can perform naval landings, and you have attached artillery and armoured car units to give a bonus in combat.

Victory is decided by two things - How quickly the British are beaten, and how quickly/completely the Republicans are beaten.

147373.name: Serenity Crew
147373.description:
Publisher blurb:

The War between the Alliance and the Independents is a sore subject for a lot of folks, some more than others. Take Captain Malcolm Reynolds for example. Now here's a guy who fought in the Battle of Serenity Valley and laid down arms in front of his enemy. That kind of experience changes a man—and it'll change you, too.

Serenity Crew allows you to spend your days playing Mal, Zoe, Wash, Kaylee, Inara, Jayne, Simon, Book, or River. If you're the type that wants to try something new, take a gander at the twelve archetypes we're offering you, too. If the math's right, that's twenty-one different options for you to play a character in the 'Verse.

Serenity Crew is part of the Echoes of War role-playing adventure series, which is centered on a common theme: the Unification War. All characters and archetypes in this release employ the Cortex Plus system. The Serenity Crew is compatible with the Echoes of War adventures and all other releases in the Firefly Role-Playing Game line, which are all sold separately. The Firefly Role-Playing Game is based on the hit television series by Fox.

This release was first featured in Gaming in the 'Verse: Gen Con 2013 Exclusive. This title is the stand-alone version.

147374.name: Shooting Fish
147374.description:
Publisher blurb:

The War may be over, but there're still plenty of bad people looking to do bad things, and they don't seem to need war as an excuse to come after their fellow man neither. Some folk will happily turn out a bunch of orphans to make themselves a few coins. Buzzard Lake is one such fella, but like all men he's got a weakness. He don't like to lose. That's where you and your crew come in. Lake needs to learn what second place feels like, and you're gonna to teach him. You might even save some orphans in the bargain if he don't kill you first.

Shooting Fish is presented by Andrew Peregrine with illustrations by Jennifer Rodgers. This Episode is part of the Echoes of War role-playing adventure series, which is centered on a common theme: the Unification War. Echoes of War adventures are compatible with the Firefly Role-Playing Game and all subsequent releases. Shooting Fish requires the Serenity Crew, which is sold separately. The Firefly Role-Playing Game is based on the hit television series by Fox.

This release was first featured in Gaming in the 'Verse: Gen Con 2013 Exclusive. This title is the stand-alone version.

147375.name: Micro Ships
147375.description:
The space fleet of the famous Ganuuk trader is for sale. 13 glorious spaceships that any space trader would be happy to put their hands on, and now you have a chance. Each ship is worth worth some victory points or will help you in acquiring other spaceships. The space trader that will earn the most victory points from the new Ganuuk spaceships will be the winner.

Micro Ships is a micro game with 13 spaceship cards, 1 resource value card and 20 resource markers (5 markers in 4 colors).

Each turn every player secretly selects his bidding resources. Simultaneously the players reveal their bid. The highest bid wins the spaceship.
Each space ship gives bidding bonus to bidding based on:

Resource bid
Spaceship color
To a specific spaceship




Once a bidding is done, value of the resources is changed based on the winning bidding resources.

The game is played in 12 rounds and the winner is the player who's ships are worth the most victory points in end of the game.

147376.description:
Cherry Bomb is a single player zilch (or also known as “Dice 10,000”) game of probability with
health and a bonus points system added.
You will need:
. 6 dice.
. Dice cup.
. A paper (Or an empty excel sheet) pad for keeping score.
. “Zilch” scoring chart.

The goal is to get to a certain point amount without running out of health.
147376.name: Cherry Bomb

147377.name: Dicey Tales (Issue 2 - Nov 2012)
147377.description:
In This Issue:


Credits
Behind The Screen
Beasts and Monsters: A bestiary for pulp era adventures
Using Contacts in Dicey Tales: It’s not always what you know; it’s who you know
New Boons and Flaws for Dicey Tales
Lemurian Lore
Ghosts in the Moon-Tower: An Adventure for the Barbarians of Lemuria Setting - by Garnett Elliott
Ghosts of Greenland: A Pulp Era adventure for Dicey Tales – by Joseph C. Wolf
The Burning Eye of Tyrannis Nova: A Legends of Steel/Barbarians of Lemuria Adventure – by Michael W. Bay

147379.description:
The Space Alert: Component Upgrade Set is a set of futuristic plastic components you can use to replace the wooden components in Space Alert.

The transparent cubes provide a more futuristic look and feel than the wooden bits that come with the game.

Available on the Board Game Geek Store, the set includes:

24 green translucent cubes
36 red translucent cubes
6 clear cubes
6 frosted white cubes
6 black translucent cubes
2 gold translucent cubes
3 green translucent cylinders
1 large dark blue translucent cylinder
147379.name: Space Alert: Component Upgrade Set

147380.description:
A new village tile for the game Keyflower. The Storyteller tile is available exclusively through Spielerei magazine edition number 101 (October 2013).

If this tile is not upgraded, a player places a worker on this tile and then takes either a worker or a skill tile, if available. If this tile has been upgraded, a player places a worker on this tile then takes a worker and a skill tile, if available.
147380.name: Keyflower: Storyteller

147382.name: The Lord of the Rings Online: Helm's Deep

videogameseries.28012: The Lord of the Rings Online

videogameexpansion.77210: The Lord of the Rings Online: Shadows of Angmar

147382.description:
THE LORD OF THE RINGS ONLINE™: HELM’S DEEP™

(NEEDHAM, MA – April 24, 2013) -- Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment unveiled today The Lord of the Rings Online™: Helm’s Deep™, the next expansion to the award-winning free-to-play massively multiplayer online roleplaying game (MMORPG) developed by Turbine. Helm’s Deep will continue the Epic Story into the western plains of Rohan, allow players to take a direct role in the battle for Helm’s Deep and advance the level cap to 95.

“With Helm’s Deep, we’re bringing the War of the Ring to players on a monumental scale,” said Kate Paiz, Executive Producer of The Lord of the Rings Online, Turbine. “Our team is thrilled to create another iconic moment in Middle-earth, and put players in the center of the action.”

THE LORD OF THE RINGS ONLINE: HELM’S DEEP FEATURES:

Experience the Battle for Helm’s Deep – Fight to defend Helm’s Deep starting at level 10, as your character enlists as a soldier in the Battle of the Hornburg, the most massive conflict yet in The Lord of the Rings Online. Earn rewards for your contribution to the war effort – win or lose, your aid makes a difference!

Explore new landscapes across Western Rohan - Explore the Westemnet of Rohan and rally each of the five Ridings as Rohan returns to glory. Traverse the capital of Edoras, mysterious Dunharrow, and the fortress of the Hornburg, deep within Helm’s Deep.

Advance from levels 85 to 95 - Experience 10 new levels, from 85 to 95, with new skills and completely updated class specializations. Both mounted and un-mounted combat will challenge you as you war against the evil of Saruman.

Continue the Epic Story - Encounter beloved characters such as Aragorn, Éowyn, and Éomer. Restore King Théoden to his rightful lordship and defend the peoples of Rohan at Helm’s Deep.

Source: The Publisher Website.

147383.name: Deviant Database
147383.description:
from the designer's blog

APOCALYGEDDON ABBERATIONS!

From the harmless to the harmful, from the weak to the wicked, the Deviant Database collects over 90 monstrous mutants that have inhabited The Savage AfterWorld!


Challenge your players with flying fiends like the flaming Dragonfire or the rampaging Flynocerous!
Oceanic adventures await with aquatic adversaries such as the Flamewhale, Oceanbrood, and Crabhemoth!
Mutant menaces like the Pumpking and Brain Lord lurk in the hidden shadows and manipulate their eager minions!


Totaling 80 pages, the Deviant Database is fully compatible with Goblinoid Games' Mutant Future and Labyrinth Lord RPGs as well as other Original Edition Fantasy RPGs.

147384.name: The Zin Letters (Issue 2)
147384.description:
From the publisher:

The second issue contains a description of the port of Lur Nop, Kralorelan cults and government, the areas and army of Loskalm, and the culture, religion and places of Daran.

Contents

Kralorela

Secrets of Lur Nop - the description of Lur Nop, the Kralorelan Port
On the Rule of Exarchs - an article about the government of Kralorela
The Order of Celestial Geomancy & Dr. Pin - two Kralorelan cults for HeroQuest
Additional material about Lur Nop online




Loskalm

The Province of Easval - the description of the Easval Province in Loskalm
The City of Ease - the description of the capital of the Easval Province
The Army of Loskalm - the principles and traditions of the Army of Loskalm
The Brotherhood of Siglat's True Light - an important brotherhood in Loskalm with HeroQuest stats




Daran

Daran - society and culture
The Church of Saint Ehilm - the description of the church in Daran with RuneQuest stats
Important Places in Daran - short descriptions about towns and places
The Barony of Ornim - the description of a barony in Daran
Scenario Ideas - six short scenario ideas for Daran
Miscellaneous Short Articles - additional material online

147385.name: Cross Racing Championship 2005
147385.description:
Utilizing the next generation of the Invictus Engine which incorporates its new real-time physics module, Cross Racing Championship (CRC) will allow the player to experience the thrills of high-speed on and off road racing across vast open terrains. The player can contest over 60 races across six distinct environments, ranging from icy mountainous regions and lush countryside to parched desert areas and beaches. CRC will appeal to Rally fans and road-racing fans with its crossover approach to vehicles and race circuits.

CRC features multiplayer action and extensive set-up options which are an integral part of the game, along with realistic real-time damage and stunning graphical effects including High Dynamic Range imaging, bump mapping, dynamic environmental reflections and motion blur and dynamic and automatic image contrast balancing.
The vehicles are fully user-customisable, both in their appearance and performance, using an intuitive and powerful interface. The game also features TV replay options and realistic sound effects.

Source: The Game Website.

147386.name: Diaspora: Shattered Armistice
147386.description:
Background
It has been 40 years since the devastating war between the Colonials and the Cylons. 40 years where no one has seen or heard of the Cylons. 40 years where the armistice has held.

Game Features
Fly the MK VII Viper, the Raptor or the new MK VIIe strike variant.
Take part in furious battles against Cylon forces.
